name: Amr Awadallah
title: Vectara CEO | I do NOT check LI Messages.
about:
With over 25 years of experience in scalable systems, big data, and AI, I am passionate about changing our collective future for the better one startup at a time. As the founder and CEO of Vectara, the trusted GenAI Platform, I lead a team of super talented AI engineers who are building a trusted GenAI platform for business data with the benefits of mitigating hallucinations, bias, copyright infringement and data privacy. 

Before founding Vectara, I was the VP of Developer Relations for Google Cloud, where I helped developers and businesses leverage the power of cloud computing. I was also the founder and global CTO of Cloudera, a leading platform for big data analytics and machine learning, where we pioneered the use of open source technologies such as Hadoop and Spark. I have a PhD in electrical engineering from Stanford University. I enjoy bridging the gap between technology, product, and business, and I am always eager to learn and share my knowledge and insights with others.

name: Ganesh Padmanabhan
title: CEO Autonomize AI | Healthcare | Host, Stories in AI
about:
I've been very lucky in my life. Growing up in a small town in Southern India, to training to play professional cricket, then changing tracks to become a mechanical engineer, marrying my beautiful wife, Anita, raising our two wonderful kids together, to a long career in tech in Asia and Corporate America, eventually being a founder. 

I am a product of the relationships I built and opportunities I was handed. In the process I built a deep skill stack around fusing business & technology, forging deep relationships & building/scaling high output organizations. 

We are building the most ambitious project of my lifetime‚ÄîAutonomize AI. Healthcare has no shortage of data. What it lacks is context, actionability, and velocity. Despite a decade of digitization, we‚Äôre still struggling to translate information into faster access, affordable care, and radically improved outcomes.

That‚Äôs the gap we‚Äôre closing. Not with dashboards or more portals‚Äîbut with compound AI agents that reason, learn, and act across workflows.

We‚Äôre not just automating. We‚Äôre Autonomizing healthcare.

üëâüèΩ Autonomizing clinical development by turning slow, static trial operations into dynamic, intelligent workflows that adapt in real time‚Äîaccelerating drug development at scale.

üëâüèΩ Delivering precision care by unlocking patient insights from charts, claims, and labs‚Äîacross silos, across formats‚Äîso care teams can personalize decisions, not guess.

üëâüèΩ Augmenting healthcare professionals with copilots that surface the signal in the noise‚Äîenabling smarter, faster, more confident decisions at every step.

üëâüèΩ Building the world‚Äôs healthcare knowledge graph‚Äîa living network of context-rich, computable insights that power better decisions across the care continuum.

üëâüèΩ Equipping every knowledge worker with their own Ironman suit‚Äîa personal AI assistant that amplifies their intelligence and reduces their burden, every day.

This is Autonomize AI. A future where every healthcare decision is intelligent, timely, and impactful.
Let‚Äôs build it‚Äîtogether. üöÄ

notable_achievements: Scaled Autonomize AI from $3 million to $30 million ARR in about two and a half years; Pioneered solutions for enterprise AI data infrastructure challenges; Led early commercial efforts at Molecula, a company focused on data engineering for AI

name: Dan Wright
title: Co-Founder and CEO at Armada
about:
As the Co-Founder and CEO of Armada, I have the privilege of leading a mission that is much larger than ourselves ‚Äî bridging the digital divide with innovative full-stack edge computing. At Armada, our goal extends beyond mere technological advancements; we are committed to making cutting-edge computing and AI solutions universally accessible, ensuring that every corner of the globe is interconnected.  
 
My entrepreneurial journey is anchored in a deep commitment to building and empowering exceptional teams, nurturing their growth, and driving operational excellence in the ever-changing landscape of disruptive technology. This journey has been marked by significant milestones and learning experiences, shaping my approach to business and leadership. 
 
Before my current role at Armada, I was at the helm of DataRobot as CEO. During my tenure, the company was featured on CNBC's Disruptor 50 and Forbes' Cloud 100 lists for three consecutive years. Our focus was on delivering trusted AI technology and enabling ROI for many of the world‚Äôs largest and most impactful companies. 
 
In my tenure as the COO of AppDynamics, I led the company's ascent to become the foremost application performance management (APM) vendor. It was a period of intense hypergrowth, culminating in AppDynamics' consistent leadership in Gartner's Magic Quadrant for APM and its eventual $3.7 billion acquisition by Cisco. 
 
Beyond these executive roles, I am deeply invested in the future of technology as an investor, advisor, and board member for various visionary startups, including Abnormal Security, Avi Networks (acquired by VMware), and Embrace. Additionally, I co-founded the Jordan Zapper Memorial Scholarship and actively contributed to the Dean's Council at Boston College. 
 
My leadership style blends empathy with innovation, striving to inspire and empower those around me. This approach extends to my engagement in philanthropy and education. I am particularly passionate about creating a future where technology and connectivity can be leveraged to overcome barriers, opening up a world of possibilities for all. 
 
I welcome connections and discussions on technological advancements, transformative solutions in connectivity, and AI. Feel free to reach out and join me in this exciting journey of innovation and global connectivity.
speaking_engagements: Interview with Pulse 2.0 about Armada and edge computing platform; Guest on GrowthCap podcast discussing Armada and technology innovation; Featured speaker on 'Arsenal of Democracy' podcast discussing AI, connectivity, and national security; Guest on Payload's Pathfinder podcast discussing Armada's partnership with SpaceX Starlink
notable_achievements: Director position at John B Sanfilippo & Son Inc
reasoning: Dan Wright demonstrates a strong track record of leading high-growth technology companies and achieving significant exits. While not a serial founder with multiple exits, he has held C-level positions at major successful companies and led one to a multi-billion dollar exit. His role as COO at AppDynamics, which was acquired for $3.7B by Cisco, and CEO position at DataRobot (a recognized unicorn company) show proven ability to scale companies to significant valuations. His current founder role at Armada, combined with his previous executive experience and board positions at successful startups, places him solidly in the L6 category as a Market Innovator and Thought Leader. The recognition of his companies on prestigious lists like CNBC's Disruptor 50 and Forbes Cloud 100 further supports this classification.

name: Jon Runyan
title: Co-Founder and COO at Armada
about:
As the Co-Founder and COO of Armada, I am deeply committed to bridging the digital divide and unlocking the full potential of AI at the true edge. My professional path, enriched by robust leadership and operational excellence, spans across technology, finance, and law. Based in San Francisco, I am driven by the ambition of propelling Armada towards revolutionary achievements in connectivity and AI.

Before Armada, I served for nearly a decade as General Counsel at Okta where I was a key partner to the CEO in leading the then 300-person company through massive hypergrowth and, ultimately, a very successful IPO. I helped lead Okta in scaling from $30M ARR as a private company to ~$2B ARR as a publicly traded company with over 6,000 employees. 

Prior to Okta, I was a Partner at Goodwin Procter, specializing in corporate and securities law, representing hundreds of technology companies and venture capital firms across the globe, counseling them through every manner of strategic transaction. 
 
I hold a BS in Business Administration (Finance) from San Diego State, an MBA from Yale, and JD from UC Hastings. I am also a seasoned angel investor who has partnered with dozens of innovative companies such as Ollama, Etched, FigureAI, SpaceX, Ironclad, Envoy, Abnormal Security, Pipe, Airbase, ClickHouse, Walnut, Cleanlab, Quantum Metric, and Vendr.   

In my role at Armada, and through my various professional and investment endeavors, I remain committed to fostering innovation and enabling transformative solutions in the world of technology and connectivity.

name: Kailash Gopalakrishnan
title: Co-Founder & Executive | Ex-IBM Fellow | AI Arch | System Design | Quantization | AI Compilers | HW-SW Codesign | Stanford Ph.D.
about:
I'd describe myself as an avid technologist who thrives at the intersection of computer architecture,  deep learning algorithms, hardware design and cloud computing. Over the past decade, my primary research and development efforts have centered around the invention and development of specialized platforms that have dramatically improved industry-wide AI systems‚Äô performance and revolutionized the incorporation of AI capabilities within IBM. 

My team's contributions to hardware-aware deep learning algorithms have led to cutting-edge work that has been instrumental in launching IBM‚Äôs AI hardware effort and the development of multiple generations of AI-optimized hardware engines. We've developed foundational low-precision algorithms and hardware designs for both deep learning training and inference leading to transformative impact on industry-wide design customizations for AI and machine learning. 

Having launched the IBM Research AI Hardware Center in collaboration with the state of NY and other industry partners, my efforts continue to focus on integrating specialized AI capabilities across a range of Enterprise and Hybrid-Cloud systems, and to broaden the ecosystem of the AI Hardware Center.

Background: I've a Bachelors in Electrical Engineering from the Indian Institute of Technology, Bombay and a Ph.D. from Stanford University. I'm currently an IBM Fellow, IBM Member Academy of Technology and Senior Manager at the IBM Research Center in Yorktown Heights, NY.

name: Felix Wong

about:
I am co-founder of Integrated Biosciences, an early-stage drug discovery company for age-related disease. Featured on the Forbes 30 Under 30 in Healthcare, I am also a research scientist at the Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard, supported by the NIH's K25 Mentored Quantitative Research Career Development Award.

As a physicist and mathematician by training, I am interested in applications of machine learning to biology, biophysics, cellular physiology, and drug discovery. My research has led to a better understanding of how drugs including antibiotics work, how the next generations of drugs can be discovered, how cells are built, and how infectious diseases spread.

name: Alex Stephany
title: CEO of Beam, Purpose Entrepreneur of the Year 2024 - HIRING for many roles at Beam - join us! üöÄ
about:
Like uplifting stories or social impact? I‚Äôm at my connection limit but if you want to see my updates please do Follow me üôè 

~~~

I love to run and grow businesses by attracting and nurturing the most talented people. 

In my last role as CEO of JustPark, I grew revenue over 10-fold in 3 years, raised funding from Index Ventures, and closed the largest equity crowdfunding for a startup in history. 

I'm now CEO of Beam (www.beam.org), bringing AI to welfare services and working with over 100 government partners. Enabled by tech and AI, our expert caseworkers have supported thousands of underserved people into homes and jobs, while our software has slashed admin for thousands of frontline workers. 

I'm also the author of a business book on the sharing economy, The Business of Sharing (Macmillan). http://amzn.to/13QZHgH. I provide expert comment on social impact, homelessness, the sharing economy and startups and have appeared on Bloomberg, Sky, NPR, the Guardian and BBC among others. 

Many people have kindly helped me over the years and I like to give back to the tech community whenever I can. I am very lucky to have mentored some hugely talented entrepreneurs through TechStars.

I love to hear from smart, creative, hungry people who want to solve meaningful problems. If you want to reach out and we've never met, you can grab me via Twitter. @AlexStephany

name: Kate Kallot
title: Founder & CEO | Building the Data Backbone for the Global South | TIME 100 Most Influential People in AI | WEF Tech Pioneer
about:
Kate Kallot is a technologist and deep tech founder recognized globally for pioneering equitable access to advanced technologies across emerging markets. 

She is the Founder & CEO of Amini, a data infrastructure company building sovereign data and compute systems for Africa and the Global South. Under her leadership, Amini is transforming fragmented analog systems into AI-ready digital ecosystems that power supply chains, climate intelligence, and government modernization.

Previously, Kate held senior leadership roles at NVIDIA, where she led global developer relations and ecosystem expansion across underserved geographies, and Arm, where she was instrumental in scaling the TinyML movement, enabling machine learning on ultra-low-power edge devices. At Intel, she spearheaded the development of the Neural Compute Stick, the world‚Äôs first USB-based AI development kit, democratizing computer vision and edge AI for millions of developers worldwide.

Her work has been recognized by TIME‚Äôs 100 Most Influential People in AI, the World Economic Forum as a Tech Pioneer, and One Young World as Entrepreneur of the Year 2024. 

A trusted voice in global AI policy and digital equity, Kate serves as Vice Chair of the ICC Global Environmental and Energy Commission and is a member of EY‚Äôs Global AI Advisory Council.

I do not respond to LinkedIn messages for hiring inquiries, instead please contact info@amini.ai

name: John Morello
title: CTO and Co-Founder at Minimus
about:
John Morello is the CTO and Co-Founder of Minimus.  Minimus helps organizations avoid 95% of vulnerabilities in their cloud apps by providing secure, minimalistic software images.

Previously, he was the CTO of Twistlock and helped take the company to over 400 customers, including 45% of the Fortune 100, and a $.5B exit to Palo Alto Networks where he served as VP of Product for Prisma Cloud.  John holds multiple cybersecurity patents and is the author of NIST SP 800-190, the Container Security Guide.

Prior to Twistlock, he was the CISO of an S&P 500 global chemical company.  Before that, he spent 14 years at Microsoft where he worked on security technologies in Windows and Azure and consulted on security projects across the DoD, intelligence community, and at the White House.

John graduated summa cum laude from LSU and lives in Baton Rouge with his wife and two sons.  A lifelong outdoorsman and NAUI Master Diver and Rescue Diver, he's former board chair of the Coalition to Restore Coastal Louisiana and current board member of the Coastal Conservation Association.

Jonathan is the CEO and co-founder of Cranium AI, Inc., the leading AI security and trust platform that spun out of the KPMG Studio in April 2023. With over 20 years of experience in information technology, cyber security, and third party risk management, he is a visionary and industry leader who drives confidence and trust in the use of secure artificial intelligence.

Before KPMG, he led Prevalent to become a Gartner and Forrester industry leader in third party risk management before its sale to Insight Venture Partners in late 2016. Jonathan is a Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) and Certified Third Party Risk Professional (CTPRP). He is also a magician and a Penn State MBA graduate who loves to perform for his kids, co-workers, clients, and friends.

As CEO and co-Founder of Mineral City AI, Dr. Meyer is redefining authentication and quality control checks through next-generation technology. Designed for seamless, high-volume verification, our proprietary system ensures instant authentication, inventory integrity, risk mitigation and supply chain security without disrupting workflows.

After graduating from Washington State University in 2006 with his B.S. in Bioengineering, Dr. Meyer received his M.D. from the Pennsylvania State University in 2010. name: Rebeca Minguela
title: Founder & CEO Clarity AI
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
Rebeca is Founder of Clarity, which tries to solve the problem of inefficient and unequal allocation of capital by developing a universal framework and building an automated tool to rate companies, projects, governments and NGOs.

Previously, she was defining and leading the Global Digital Transformation Program at Santander Bank (one of the largest banks in the World). 

Rebeca was Founder & CEO of Blink Booking, the award winning last minute hotel booking mobile app leader in Europe, with more than 800,000 downloads, almost 3,000 hotels, available in 6 languages. Rebeca and Blink Booking have been featured widely in the press in several countries with features in publications including Forbes, The Economist, Financial Times, The Sun, The Daily Mirror, El Pais, El Mundo, Il Sole 24 Ore, and many others. 

Blink was acquired by Groupon in Sept 2013, less than 1 and a half years after having launched the product. After the acquisition, Rebeca worked at Groupon, where she was Senior Director of Product and Operations and General Manager, leading one of the top priorities of the company. 

She is also advisor at several startups, mostly focusing on early stage startup with huge potential to make a significant impact.

Prior to Blink, Rebeca worked as Sr Associate at Bain Capital Private Equity, management consultant at Boston Consulting Group and as engineer at German Aerospace Agency, Siemens and IBM. She holds an MBA from Harvard Business School, MSc in Telecommunication Engineering for Polytechnic University in Madrid and Stuttgart University (all of them with Distinction).

name: Ry Walker
title: founder of Tembo, your tireless AI teammate that watches your systems, hunts down bugs, optimizes databases, and ships features while you focus on the fun stuff.
about:
I'm a long-time software engineer, founder, and champion of open source.

I'm currently building Tembo, your tireless AI teammate that watches your systems, hunts down bugs, optimizes databases, and ships features while you focus on the fun stuff.

In 2022 I created OSSRank, a public ranking of open-source software and people.

In 2015 I co-founded Astronomer, one of Cincinnati's first tech unicorns.

In 2013 I co-founded Differential, a venture studio built around the open-source Meteor framework.

In the 00's I was CTO for a couple of Cincinnati-based software companies, specializing in open-source Ruby on Rails.

In the 90's I built and sold a web agency, leveraging open-source Perl and PHP.

I love nature, science, art, tennis, platform tennis, golf, basketball, fishing and indie game development.

As CEO and Co-Founder of Revv, Adi Bathla leads a mission to transform the automotive repair industry with AI-powered SaaS solutions that drive safety, profitability, precision, and efficiency. Under his leadership, Revv has introduced award-winning products, including Revv ADAS Plus and Revv ADAS Mechanical, which empower repair shops to navigate the complexities of ADAS calibration and diagnostics. By equipping shops with intelligent workflows, seamless integrations, and advanced diagnostics, Adi is helping the industry stay ahead in a rapidly advancing vehicle landscape.

He is passionate about creating innovative, scalable solutions that empower mission-driven businesses to succeed in fast-evolving markets.

name: Anupam Agarwal
title: Co-founder & CEO @ Revv | Ex McKinsey | IIMC
about:
Only 3% of Indians own cars, Vs 90% of Americans. How to make cars an accessible household item in a country where they are status symbols? That‚Äôs the question that I set out to answer with Revv.

Left McKinsey to build Revv, raised money at 1000 Cr valuation within ~4 years of starting. Saw Covid burn it all up, and then built it all over again. Our users have clocked distance worth 10,000 trips around the earth, and yet it feels like barely scratching the surface. Long way to go.

Prior to Revv, I had the privilege of spending 9 years at what I believe is the best university in the world - McKinsey & Company. Repeated cycles of learning and delivering impact across diverse contexts gave me invaluable lessons and the self-belief to take the entrepreneurial plunge.

name: Niraj Tolia
title: Chief Technology Officer at Veeam Software
about:
Niraj Tolia is the CEO and Co-Founder at Alcion. He was previously the CEO of Kasten, a company he founded in order to solve the problem of Kubernetes backup and disaster recovery. After its acquisition by Veeam, he served as the General Manager and President and the SVP, Strategy of Kasten by Veeam. He also was a Governing Board member of the Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF).

With a strong technical background in distributed systems, storage, and data management, he has held multiple leadership roles in the past, including Senior Director of Engineering for Dell EMC's CloudBoost group and VP of Engineering and Chief Architect at Maginatics (acquired by EMC). Dr. Tolia received his PhD, MS, and BS in Computer Engineering from Carnegie Mellon University.

name: Chris Walti
title: Co-Founder / CEO of Mytra
about:
I'm applying two decades of software and hardware engineering experience to the massive challenge of modernizing automation for supply chain and manufacturing industries. The strain on supply chains and manufacturing systems require immediate and disruptive solutions. PLCs are rigid by design and today's "industrial" products are 4x the cost with .25x the capability vs. standard enterprise tools. Most organizations don't have legions of control engineers to roll out needed systems or take on the tech debt. Mytra provides a platform to simply and efficiently solve the most common task in industry - moving and storing material throughout the facility. These non value add tasks employ between 25-75% of the labor for any industrial operation. Mytra develops a novel racking structure providing a 3D grid traversable along all 3 axes, robots to move material within the system, and the software to easily design, operate, and continuously optimize without the need for automation engineers.

Previous to Mytra I created and led Tesla's Mobile Robotics team. We design, develop, build, and deploy robots across Tesla's manufacturing portfolio. The team includes mechanical, electrical, software, controls, perception, manufacturing, and operations experts. We create wheeled mobile robots that serve our factories, and also develop the humanoid Tesla Bot (Optimus).

My professional experiences involve leading engineering teams to design and launch new products, both as an entrepreneur and an "intrapreneur" (within existing companies). They combine hardware and software. The technical challenges/risk and level of responsibility have increased with each role.
speaking_engagements: Featured in EO's Partner Highlight video discussing Mytra and hardware innovation; Interview on Alejandro Cremades podcast about raising $78 million and entrepreneurial journey
notable_achievements: Led Tesla's robotics team and spearheaded development of the Optimus robot; Founded Mytra to innovate industrial automation with integrated hardware-software solutions; Raised significant venture capital funding for Mytra
reasoning: Chris Walti demonstrates significant executive and technical leadership experience, particularly through his role leading Tesla's Mobile Robotics team, which involves complex hardware/software integration and management of cross-functional teams. His position at Tesla represents senior operational experience at a major tech company, and his current venture Mytra shows entrepreneurial initiative in a complex technical space. name: Nikita Gupta
title: Co-Founder @Careerflow.ai | Keynote Speaker | Ex-Senior Technical Recruiter @Uber | Ex @Amazon | 476K+ Followers | TEDx Speaker | Daily AI content about job search tips | YouTuber
about:
Introducing Nikita, a seasoned professional who has worn many hats, from engineering and data analytics to talent recruitment. With experience at tech giants like Uber and Amazon Web Services as a senior technical recruiter, she has honed her skills in the industry. Nikita began her journey of helping job seekers with FAANGPath, where she used her expertise and passion for career development, before launching Careerflow.ai, an AI-powered career platform that has helped over a thousand job seekers land their dream jobs.

With a social media following of over 500,000, she's become a trusted voice in the field, inspiring others to navigate their career paths confidently. Notably, she was honored with the prestigious Entrepreneur of the Year award by the Women in IT Summit & Awards Series, underscoring her innovative spirit and leadership in the field.

about:
Howdy! I'm Armando Vera Carvajal, the CEO and Co-Founder of Hangtight, your social passport. We're building the future of social with an AI agent named Hank that facilitates serendipity and real-life connection. We streamline social coordination and make it effortless for friends to connect by reducing many of the informational asymmetries that create friction between people. 

With 16+ years of experience in global product development, launch, and management, I lead the vision, strategy, and execution of our company across all area under the guidance of our world-class advisory board and in tandem with my co-founder, Rich Fortune. Hangtight is live and free to download on both iOS and Android - so go play!

Before Hangtight, I co-founded and led an online accelerator that helped entrepreneurs raise funding and scale their businesses, from zero to one. In 3.5 years, we grew our team from 5 to 150+, our customer base from 0 to 3,000+, and our revenue from 0 to seven figures. I also built and managed our global network of mentors and investors, which reached over 7,000 members across 60 countries.

I'm a first-generation immigrant from Mexico who grew up in McAllen (South Texas) and have been living in Austin for +15 years. I also speak English, Spanish, French, and Italian.

I'm also a Texas Ex and UT Longhorn! I studied international relations and corporate communication at the University of Texas at Austin, Sciences Po Paris, and at NTU Singapore. Hook 'Em!!

name: Jeff Holmes
title: Head of XR and Learning at Convai
about:
Artificial intelligence (AI) is transforming how people learn. Recent progress in AI, especially around large language models, is opening up new opportunities for the development of smart learning partners. These AI partners have the ability to act as experts in both content and how people learn, and will serve as incredibly powerful guides for individualized learning.

In my role at Convai.com, I explore new opportunities to integrate Conversational AI agents into a variety of learning platforms. These range from virtual and augmented reality environments to digital textbooks and online courses. I'm excited to see how increasing student engagement and agency through the use of AI will impact learning. We have just begun.

My background in education research and development, science, and veterinary medicine has led to a career with the main goal of understanding and improving how people learn. As we move towards a ‚Äúlearn anywhere‚Äù culture, where the classroom becomes a place for more personalized instruction and guidance, there is a need for online environments to support active learning opportunities. This will go far beyond simply providing lesson plans for offline use. The next generation learning environments should support project based learning programs that encourage creativity, sharing, and participation.

I previously worked at Harvard University as Digital Learning Editor for the Encyclopedia of Life (EOL). EOL is an international collaboration focused on the ‚Äúbig data‚Äù problem of scientific information about life on Earth. My work involved designing, developing, and implementing innovative tools, applications, and courses that help make the Encyclopedia of Life more accessible and meaningful for learners of all ages.
notable_achievements: Founder and CEO of Fanatic Fans; Founder of First Ascent Associates
reasoning: Jeff Holmes demonstrates strong technical and academic credentials with a PhD in Educational Technology from Vanderbilt and significant experience in educational technology development. name: Amber Nigam
title: CEO, basys.ai | Harvard | 40u40 | Building the Agentic AI OS for Healthcare
about:
I am a healthcare entrepreneur with over fourteen years of experience at the intersection of AI and healthcare. As the co-founder and CEO of basys.ai, I lead the strategy, business development, and fundraising efforts. At basys.ai, we focus on using generative AI to address key challenges in prior authorization and utilization management, aiming to make care more patient-centric, accessible, and efficient.

This work is deeply personal. After seeing my father‚Äôs struggle with delayed medical treatments, I co-founded basys.ai to address the administrative inefficiencies that contribute to such delays. Our team, which includes experts from organizations like Kaiser Permanente, Mass General Brigham, WHO, UN, Cerner, Stanford University School of Medicine, MIT, and Harvard, is backed by reputable institutions such as Mayo Clinic, Eli Lilly, Highmark, and CareFirst Blue Cross Blue Shield.

I hold a bachelor‚Äôs in Computer Science and an MS in Health Data Science from Harvard University, where I was a Cheng Fellow and Roslyn & Lisle Payne Scholar. I have been recognized as one of the 40 Under 40 by the Boston Congress of Public Health.

Previously, I founded Kydots.ai, leading the company through its growth and successful acquisition. My passion for building and scaling ventures extends to mentoring startups at TechStars, Harvard, MIT, MassChallenge, and XLerateHealth. I‚Äôve also co-instructed an MIT course on AI applications in healthcare, where I explored how technology can directly improve patient care. As a former co-Director of the Harvard Business Club, I provided strategic and fundraising support to Harvard-affiliated founders, helping them transform their ideas into impactful businesses.

Beyond entrepreneurship, I contribute to shaping the healthcare and AI conversation. I‚Äôve authored Op-Ed articles in STAT News, Becker‚Äôs Healthcare, and Forbes and have shared insights on global platforms, including TEDx, Mayo Clinic, DuPont, and Udacity. The companies I‚Äôve founded have been featured in Forbes and TechCrunch, highlighting their impact and innovation in AI and healthcare.

name: Alex Song
title: Founder & CEO @ Proxima - building AI to optimize user acquisition at scale
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
Before starting Proxima, I founded 3 DTC brands ‚Äì one that I exited, one I had to shut down, and one that's still thriving.

Like any DTC founder, I've been impacted by recent changes in the digital marketing landscape that have made scaling a digital brand harder than it‚Äôs ever been. 

Between the increased price of Meta advertising and over 70% of iOs users opting out of app tracking, customer acquisition costs have skyrocketed 50% ‚Äì and VC capital for consumer brands is harder to come by than ever. 

I started Proxima AI because I needed a solution to my own pain. When it worked, I started sharing it with other founders in my network. And it grew from there.

The biggest challenges for digital brands in 2023:

-It's much harder to determine your ideal customer. 
-Companies are acquiring customers but ultimately failing to scale profitably.
-Investors need positive cashflow or, at a minimum, a clear path to profitability before taking a chance on new digital brands. 

The strategies that *won‚Äôt* fix this:

‚ùåUsing insufficient data to drive effective targeting.
‚ùåWaiting for media platforms to provide you with the insights you need to scale today.
‚ùåThe ‚Äúspray and pray‚Äù approach to advertising ‚Äì wasting money on a ‚Äútest and fail‚Äù cycle.

Proxima leverages anonymized first-party data and more than 60 million unique shopper personas from a network of 13,000 brands to reach new customers, lower acquisition costs, and increase ROI on ad spend. 

Proxima's audience targeting technology will help you to:

‚úÖImprove profitability
‚úÖAcquire customers more efficiently
‚úÖScale customer acquisition spend *meaningfully* 

Our clients have seen averages of over 1.5x scale in prospecting spend within 30 days *while* improving CPA by 26% and ROAS by 31% ‚Äì providing significant incrementality and reducing the diminishing returns that come with increased marketing spend.

We‚Äôre currently seeing the most challenging conditions as an industry since DTC first emerged as a business model. 

Digital brands need to adapt to survive in this new ecosystem.

Proxima gives you the edge to do more than just survive ‚Äì

We're giving you the tools to thrive.

Book a free demo today.

location: New York, New York, United States
about:
http://teffland.github.io

In January 2022, I co-founded Noetica AI. We are using machine reading and knowledge base construction to help stakeholders understand large collections of documents in a high-value fintech application. We're hiring, feel free to reach out.


In October 2022, I defended my PhD thesis, "Toward Annotation Efficiency in Biased Learning Settings for Natural Language Processing." I was advised by Mike Collins. I'm broadly interested in machine learning, natural language processing, and how machine reading can help us make sense of vast oceans of text so that we can be better informed and make smarter choices. The thesis focuses on how we can do more in this space with less manual effort by embracing biased labeling settings and high-level expert knowledge. It does this by contributing core methodological advances in loss functions for NLP models that make them better with less/biased data.

name: Ksenia Iliuk
title: AI vs Information Operations | Co-Founder @LetsData | 30U30
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
I didn‚Äôt plan to start a company.  I just got tired of watching information operations win.

For years, I was responsible for detecting them. But all I had were tools to investigate what had already happened. We were always reacting. Never ahead. We were always reacting. Never ahead.

So we built LetsData.

Born in wartime Ukraine, LetsData is a solution that detects information operations before they strike - before fake pages go live, before campaigns gain traction, before narratives spiral out of control.

Before LetsData, I worked with multiple European governments to strengthen their detection capabilities and build resilience to hostile influence. I briefed NATO and EU officials, designed methodologies to spot early signs of manipulation, and authored dozens of publications on information security and media threats.

As the CEO of Wherobots, I spearhead a team that's developing the spatial intelligence cloud. I'm a seasoned scientist and serial entrepreneur with a strong background in artificial intelligence and data science. name: Mary Beth Chalk
title: Co-founder & Chief Commercial Officer | Healthcare Industry Expert
about:
My journey in healthcare began over 25-years ago working with health systems across the US on data-informed quality improvement and reengineering efforts to optimize outcomes in the treatment setting. As a result of this work I became fascinated with finding the "signal" in data and utilizing the signal to inform decision making and to drive impact. I applied this passion for finding and taking action on data signals within mental health, population health, and chronic disease management.  

Fast forward to today, I am working with a team of incredible professionals to deliver a privacy enhancing collaboration platform to enable AI, ML, and LLM models to compute on personally identifiable information, including personal health information without compromising patient privacy, data sovereignty, or intellectual property of the models.  Computing on data with this level of fidelity is critical if we are going to achieve the promised breakthroughs of precision medicine and AI.

name: Jeroen Koeleman
title: CEO MarketLeap ‚Ä¢ Retail-groeiambitie met je merk? We got you. ü§ùüèΩ
about:
Met MarketLeap zijn wij de go-to partner voor DTC-merken die hun zakelijke afzetkanalen willen vergroten. Ons doel is helder: succesvolle merken helpen om (meer) zakelijke bestellingen te genereren en strategische partnerships aan te gaan die √©cht impact maken.

Backstory 
In de afgelopen jaren heb ik in verschillende functies op strategisch niveau mogen bijdragen aan de groei van diverse online merken en bedrijven. Van de tekentafel tot succesvolle scale-ups: sommige van deze bedrijven zijn inmiddels uitgegroeid tot koplopers op de Europese markt. Dat proces ‚Äì van bouwen, groeien en resultaten behalen ‚Äì is niet alleen een professionele uitdaging, maar geeft ook enorm veel voldoening.

Wat ik de afgelopen jaren merkte, was dat veel DTC-merken vooral gefocust zijn op online verkoop, terwijl de grootste groeipotentie vaak ligt in het betreden van de zakelijke markt. Denk aan fysieke winkels, samenwerkingen aangaan met distributeurs en groothandels, of de verkoop stimuleren via andere B2B-kanalen. Hier komt MarketLeap in beeld.

Bij MarketLeap zijn wij erin gespecialiseerd om DTC-merken op te schalen via business-to-business verkoopstrategie√´n. 

Wij ontzorgen succesvolle DTC-merken (met een omzet van ‚Ç¨1M tot ‚Ç¨50M per jaar) om de maximale potentie te benutten wat betreft het betreden van nieuwe markten. Door strategische B2B-samenwerkingen op te zetten en lucratieve partnerships te cre√´ren, helpen we merken om op te schalen, duurzaam te groeien en een solide positie in de zakelijke markt te verwerven.

Met honderden succesverhalen hebben we inmiddels bewezen dat onze aanpak werkt. We zijn gepassioneerd over het verbinden van sterke merken met waardevolle zakelijke partners en dragen zo bij aan langdurig succes.

Meer weten of case studies inzien?

name: Chris Rust
title: Partner at Clear Ventures
about:
Chris is an IT VC. He devotes all of his professional efforts to helping technology startup teams build great companies, often from the humblest of beginnings.   

Chris's experiences include: 21 years of technology venture investing as Founding Partner of Clear Ventures, Partner at Sequoia Capital and USVP; 12 years of company building as co-founder (badge #2) and lead architect of broadband access pioneer Roadrunner/TWC Internet (Charter Communications); startup PLM at Carrier Access (IPO CACS) and Comcore (NSM); and technical staff at US West and MITRE. He is currently working on stealth projects while supporting his active portfolio.

Since 1998 Chris has made early stage investments in ~40 startups, starting 35x at seed/series A and 5x at series B.  His first 24 exits have produced $32B+ of market cap from market-leading companies such as GoPro (IPO GPRO), Dune (BRCM), Mellanox (IPO MLNX), Syndesis (SUBEX), LVL7 (BRCM), VxTel (INTC), Avanex (IPO AVNX), Telera (Alcatel), SwitchOn (PMCS), and Abrizio (PMCS). name: David Lucas
title: Strategist ‚Äì Leader - Investor ‚îÇ
about:
David Lucas is the co-founder (w/ Eric Rock) and chief strategy officer of Percipio Health, Inc., a new population health monitoring and management platform tackling two of the most pressing and interrelated challenges in health care:  (1) unsustainable healthcare spending and (2) an increasingly complex patient population. 

More specifically, Percipio Health is an end-to-end AI-guided platform for scalable, low-cost Population Health Monitoring. Percipio provides device-free daily patient health monitoring via their own smartphone to inform a whole-person view of health that providers and payers use to proactively identify health risks, drive earlier discovery of undiagnosed conditions, guide clinical diagnosis and treatment with next best actions, and level up clinicians to enhance clinical efficiencies.

Before Percipio, Lucas has demonstrated repeated entrepreneurial-spirited successes in the Healthcare IT arena, having played key leadership roles in two back-to-back HCIT start-ups prior to founding Percipio Health. 

In 2013, Lucas joined Vivify Health as an original founding (and funding) team member (one of six), serving over the next nine years in a variety of executive leadership team roles reporting to the CEO, including Chief Strategy Officer, VP of Sales, and VP of Strategic Business.  

Due to the significant and rapid growth achieved across hundreds of hospitals and large health systems, Vivify was successfully acquired by Optum (division of United Health Group) in August, 2019.  For three years prior to the Optum acquisition, Lucas ran point with initiating and developing the UHG relationship, eventually culminating in the acquisition.  

Prior to Vivify Health, Lucas spent nine years at MEDHOST, joining in the company‚Äôs early start-up stage.  Under Lucas‚Äôs direction as Vice President of Sales reporting to the CEO, MEDHOST became the leading Emergency Department solution serving over 500 hospitals and 10 million patients annually. In 2012, MEDHOST successfully exited through its acquisition by Healthcare Management Systems (HMS).     

Before the aforementioned 18 years in HCIT, Lucas enjoyed a diverse career in Medical Technology, specializing in Medical Sales & Marketing across various leading organizations such as Medtronic (implantable neurological devices), US Surgical (surgical stapling and laparoscopic instrumentation), and C.R. Bard (urologic devices).

name: Eric Rock
title: Digital Health & AI Pioneer / CEO & Co-Founder Percipio Health
about:
My passions and expertise live at the cross-section of innovation, entrepreneurship, AI, and healthcare.  I have founded, scaled, and exited three high-growth software companies and am launching a new venture: Percipio Health.

Percipio is an end-to-end AI-guided platform for scalable, low-cost population health monitoring and management.  We are taking a new approach to how healthcare providers and payers support patient populations of growing size, risk, and complexity.  Patients can share health statuses via their smartphones, without additional devices. Clinicians and care teams can work smarter with AI-guided insights to improve care delivery and quality without increasing workload burden.  It is all designed to improve value-based care and outcomes.

Previously, I founded Vivify Health, the first mobile+cloud remote patient monitoring platform connecting providers with patients via wireless consumer devices.  Vivify grew rapidly among large healthcare customers representing 1,000+ hospitals and health plans.  As the #1 RPM platform, Vivify was acquired by UnitedHealth Group / Optum in 2019.

Before Vivify, I co-founded MEDHOST, the leading emergency department solution and the first touchscreen EMR.  While ranked as the #1 EMR for emergency departments, MEDHOST was acquired by HMS, who assumed the MEDHOST brand.

Prior to MEDHOST, I founded ProHost, the first-ever restaurant table management and reservations system, creating an entirely new market segment for the hospitality sector.  ProHost was acquired by OpenTable.com, as their core product at launch, which ultimately scaled to become the largest restaurant reservation platform globally.

I continue to focus on emerging technologies and business strategies for healthcare.  You might catch me at key digital health events such as HLTH, HIMSS, ATA and others.

name: Jonathan A.
title: Founder at Findly.ai & Divbrands
about:
I am a seasoned entrepreneur with experience in ideating, launching, and operating consumer and technology ventures.

In 2017, I founded Divbrands.io and have since scaled it into a leading global direct-to-consumer venture studio with a collection of apparel and footwear brands that our customers love. Divbrands is frequently recognized by Google as one of the most innovative advertisers globally.

In 2022, I co-founded Findly.ai with a talented tech team comprising ex-Google and ex-Meta engineers. Our goal is to help business leaders, traders and investors increase their confidence in their highest-value decisions by leveraging internal and external data and building predictive modeling. Findly is backed by YCombinator and was selected by Google's inaugural AI accelerator.

I graduated from EHL in Switzerland and pursued further executive education at Stanford GSB, Harvard Kennedy, and Chicago Booth. I'm currently pursuing the OPM program (cohort 64) at Harvard Business School.

Alongside my entrepreneurial ventures, I occasionally engage in angel investing and support non-profit initiatives in education and technology. I am an active member of YPO and the WEF Global Shaper community.

My main skills are in building the right team, ensuring alignment, and maintaining a clear focus on what unlocks the most long-term value for the business.

name: Jerome Pesenti
title: Sizzle AI, Founder
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
I have been involved with artificial intelligence, natural language processing, and search for the past 25 years. I most recently led the AI team at Meta -- pursuing fundamental and applied research in AI and making Meta products safer and more valuable to people through the use of AI. MetaAI's main contributions during my time there were PyTorch, AI for content moderation, very large models for ads and recommendations, and FAIR's research breakthroughs.

Previously I was co-CEO of BenevolentAI, which develops novel AI technologies that will change how drugs are discovered. Before that, I managed a global team of researchers and software engineers within IBM Watson. My team was doing research and developing state-of-the-art software in question and answering, dialog, speech, natural language processing, and automated machine translation. Our biggest research focus was on leveraging deep learning for all these tasks. We were also responsible for the Watson Developer Cloud, which exposes these technologies as easy-to-consume cloud services.

I joined IBM through its acquisition of Vivisimo, the search and text analytics company I co-founded in 2000. Vivisimo grew organically to 130 employees and had many large corporate and government customers such as P&G, Airbus, J&J, DIA, SSA, and the US Air Force. Vivisimo's technology was based on the machine learning research I conducted with my co-founders in the CS department of CMU from  1998 to 2000. 

On the policy side, I served as co-chair of an independent review on the growth of AI commissioned by the UK government. This report led to a sector deal - https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/artificial-intelligence-sector-deal/ai-sector-deal - and most of its recommendations have been since implemented by the UK government.
speaking_engagements: Speaker at ASU+GSV Summit; Guest on AI For All Podcast; Guest on The Pulse podcast by Inside Higher Ed
notable_achievements: Led AI team at Meta, contributing to PyTorch development and AI for content moderation; Co-CEO of BenevolentAI; Led IBM Watson's global research team in NLP and machine learning; Co-chaired UK government independent review on AI growth leading to AI sector deal
reasoning: Jerome Pesenti demonstrates a strong pattern of innovation leadership and market impact in AI, with multiple significant achievements. He co-founded Vivisimo (successful exit to IBM), led major AI initiatives at Meta and IBM Watson, and co-led BenevolentAI. His track record shows consistent ability to drive technological innovation and build significant enterprise value. name: Kunal Punera
title: Co-founder & CTO Bluebirds (YC W23) | ex-Director at LinkedIn | ex-Google | ex-RelateIQ | ex-Yahoo Research | Deep Learning, NLP, Product
about:
Right now, I am founder of a startup where we are building AI-powered signals to help sales reps find warm leads and close deals faster. We are part of the W23 batch of YC. 

Most recently, I was Director of AI at LinkedIn where I built and ran 3 AI/Data teams that owned all ML-powered features in LinkedIn Recruiter, Premium, and Learning products; accounting for multi-billion dollars in annual revenue for LinkedIn.  

Before that as an Engineering Manager at Google, I hired and grew 3 engineering teams that were responsible for all the social features of Android Messages. 

In 2014, co-founded and was the CTO of Bento Labs, where we are working on building an AI-enabled OS for Android devices. There I recruited and grew a team of talented engineers from RelateIQ, Coursera, and VMware, and built and launched our first product, Scout Launcher, which was highly rated on the Android Play store (> 4.5 stars) and used for > 30 mins each day by its users. 

In 2012, I joined RelateIQ as the 4th engineer, where I led the Data Products Engineering team that built data products that mine and deliver relationship intelligence within our app; for example, automated suggestions to follow-up with contacts. I used included various kinds of unsupervised analysis, NLP, some supervised learning, etc.

I was a Senior Research Scientist at Yahoo! Research where I worked on a wide-array of topics like web search, computational advertising, behavioral targeting, online abuse prevention, etc.  

I got my PhD at Univ. of Texas at Austin in the area of Machine Learning, Data Mining, and Algorithms. A partial list of my academic work can be found at https://scholar.google.com/scholar?q=kunal+punera
education_1_school: The University of Texas at Austin
notable_achievements: Staff Engineer at Google; Former Co-Founder & CTO at Bento Labs; Former Data Engineer at RelateIQ; Former Research Scientist at Yahoo; Ph.D. in Computer Engineering from UT Austin; Published numerous papers in top conferences and journals
reasoning: Kunal Punera demonstrates strong technical leadership and operational experience at major tech companies combined with previous founder experience. His profile shows a progression from academic research (PhD) to senior technical roles at major companies (Yahoo, Google, LinkedIn) to founding ventures. While his current startup (Bluebirds) is early-stage, his previous founder experience at Bento Labs and early engineering leadership at RelateIQ (which was acquired by Salesforce) places him solidly in the L4 category as a 'Proven Operator with Executive Experience.' His director-level role at LinkedIn managing AI teams responsible for billion-dollar revenue products particularly demonstrates proven operational capability at scale.

My core research area of interest is useful, sustainable, inclusive, privacy forward software. Something we're building everyday at Zeplyn.

name: Padmanabhan Krishnamurthy
title: Co-founder at EzDubs (YC W23)
about:
Currently building EzDubs.


Bio (Updated 2021): ‚Üì

Project details and media available at www.padmanabhankrishnamurthy.com

Padmanabhan (Paddy) Krishnamurthy is a first-year Master of Computer Science student at Columbia University. He completed his Bachelor of Engineering degree with highest honours in Computer Science from the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (HKUST), graduating as the youngest recipient of both the university's President's Cup and its Outstanding Students' Award.

His research and career interests lie at the intersection of machine learning, accessibility, and productivity tools. Select projects include:

‚Ä¢ Helen - an internationally acclaimed wearable camera for AI-driven lipreading
‚Ä¢ Sound-of-Silence - an award-winning project for generating intelligible speech from silent video
‚Ä¢ Clearbot - intelligent marine waste detection systems for autonomous ocean cleaning robots.
He has also spent time at Uber, where he built machine learning systems for driver quality control.

Having presented his work at multiple international fora and trained for over 4 years in drama and oratory, Paddy likes working with innovative and creative teams to drive impactful, real-world change.

name: Robert A. Faiella
title: Past-President, American Dental Association, Chair, Board of Fellows, Harvard School of Dental Medicine, and Chief Dental Officer/Co-Founder, 32Health, Inc.
about:
Dr. Faiella is a Past-President of the American Dental Association, and Past-Chairman and Director of ADA Business Enterprises, Inc., the for-profit subsidiary of the American Dental Association.  He maintains a private practice limited to Periodontics and Dental Implant Surgery in Osterville and Duxbury, Massachusetts. In addition, he currently serves as Immediate Past-President of the American Board of Periodontology, and President-Elect of the American College of Dentists.

Dr. Faiella is the Chair of the Harvard School of Dental Medicine Board of Fellows.  He is also the former Chief Dental Officer and current Advisor for Overjet, Inc.

He received his pre-doctoral education from Villanova University, receiving two Bachelor of Science degrees, and his D.M.D degree from Fairleigh Dickinson University School of Dental Medicine.  He completed his graduate training in Periodontology as an NIH Post-Doctoral Fellow at Harvard School of Dental Medicine, as well as a Master of Medical Science (M.M.Sc.) degree from Harvard Medical School, and a Master of Business Administration (M.B.A.) from the MIT Sloan School of Management.  

He is a Diplomate of the American Board of Periodontology, and a Fellow of the American College of Dentists, the International College of Dentists, the Pierre Fauchard Academy, the Academy of Osseointegration, and the International Team for Implantology.

Dr. Faiella is a former faculty in post-doctoral periodontics at Harvard School of Dental Medicine.  He has lectured nationally and internationally on topics in periodontics and implant surgical techniques and has published on a variety of issues related to periodontal and implant surgical applications.

Dr. Faiella received the Distinguished Alumnus Award from the Harvard School of Dental Medicine in 2013.  He has also been invited to deliver the Commencement Address to eight Schools of Dental Medicine over the past 12 years. 

He has served on numerous councils and committees within the dental profession on the national, constituent, and component levels, and is a Past-President of the Massachusetts Dental Society, former ADA First District Trustee, and past General Chair of the Yankee Dental Congress.

I love to create. To bring order and beauty into the ordinary. Whether it‚Äôs the interior of the home or the tools we use for work - everything can be made better, more pleasant and functional through design. The balance between function and aesthetics.

I seek that balance in all lines of life and I believe that good design can make a better society.

Bulgaria has many brilliant creative minds. I wanted see how and why they do, what they do. So I started Fill & Stroke - a design collective. Together we are a team that organizes Show & Tell meetups and Design Battles. We want to unite creatives of all fields around the love for what they do and learn from each other. 

I don‚Äôt know where all this will take me, but one thing I am certain about. Design can make a better society and I live to see a better Bulgaria.

name: Etienne Bernard
title: Founder & CEO at NuMind | YC S22
about:
I am a machine learning expert & entrepreneur seeking to spread the use of machine learning by simplifying its usage.

After a Ph.D. & postdoc in statistical physics, I joined Wolfram Research where I became the head of the machine learning group for 7 years. There, I led the development of automatic learning tools for the Wolfram Language, a user-friendly deep learning framework, and various machine learning applications. After this experience I decided to write a book to share my understanding of machine learning (https://www.wolfram-media.com/products/introduction-to-machine-learning.html).

I recently disengaged from Wolfram to start a company called NuMind (https://www.numind.ai) which is a software company developing high-level machine learning tools and applications. With this company, my goal is to make machine learning tools that are even more accessible than the ones we developed at Wolfram Research, yet without compromise on how well they perform.

Let me know if you are interested in using NuMind technology or would like to be involved in some way.

name: Yudara Kularathne
title: AI Agents | CEO HeHealth and Aagee, Consultant Physician (EM), On a mission to impact one billion lives in the next 5 years, Developing AI-driven screening tests and AI agents for Healthcare/ Finance / Law
about:
Entrepreneur, Engineer and Medical Doctor ‚Äî and relentless optimist: I may not wear a cape, but as an Emergency Physician and the founder of HeHealth, I step in when people are at their most vulnerable.

Three years ago, a close friend nearly took his own life‚Äîcrushed by the stigma surrounding STIs. Every day, over a million people contract an STI, yet it remains one of the most silenced public health crises. That moment sparked a wild, almost unthinkable idea: I founded HeHealth‚Äîa decentralized, digital diagnostics platform for infectious diseases, starting with STIs. Our mission? To tackle one of the world‚Äôs most stigmatized and underserved health problems, head-on.

‚ÄúAnything new or innovative, prepare to be misunderstood.‚Äù ‚Äî Jeff Bezos
Our early days were a storm: global media backlash painted us as reckless, governments launched legal threats, half our team walked away, and I sold my house to keep the company alive. We ran out of money more times than I can count‚Äîbut each setback only fueled our resolve.

‚ÄúTrue innovation requires taking risks and being willing to fail.‚Äù ‚Äî Jensen Huang
Today, HeHealth has served over half a million people and powers government programs around the world‚Äîbringing life-saving detection to millions and sparking the largest global conversation on AI and sexual health.

As an AI engineer, I design and build my own algorithms from the ground up‚Äîyes, a doctor who codes. Now, with multiple technology patents to my name, some even call me ‚Äúthe guy who monetized d*ck pics.‚Äù

I previously served as a Consultant Emergency Physician with SingHealth at Sengkang General Hospital‚Äîleading a team treating over 8,000 pediatric emergencies annually. Now, I continue as a Visiting Consultant Physician at SKH and a guest lecturer at universities worldwide, dedicating 10% of my time to clinical and academic work.

When I‚Äôm not charting the future of digital diagnostics, you‚Äôll find me diving with sharks or hiking in remote mountains‚Äîalways chasing new perspectives. I‚Äôll stumble, I‚Äôll fall, but I‚Äôll keep pushing upward and forward. Let‚Äôs embrace the hard road together‚Äîour greatest impact lies just ahead.

about:
As the CEO of BreezeML, a startup that builds the platform for GenAI testing and evaluations, a Full Professor of Computer Science at UCLA, and an ACM Distinguished Scientist, I have over 20 years of experience in developing and applying cutting-edge techniques for data analytics and artificial intelligence. My mission is to make AI more responsible, accessible, efficient, and affordable for various domains and applications, leveraging insights from operating systems, distributed systems, compilers, and programming languages.

I have led teams that have built next-generation cloud infrastructures, optimizing compilers, and runtime bloat detection tools for large-scale data processing and machine learning pipelines, collaborating with leading industry partners such as Microsoft and IBM. I have also received the prestigious 2018 Dahl-Nygaard Junior Prize for my contributions to the field of object orientation, and published multiple papers in top-tier conferences and journals. I am passionate about advancing the state of the art in machine learning and computer systems, and mentoring the next generation of researchers and innovators.

name: Marc Lore
title: Serial Entrepreneur | Moonshot Seeker | Mission Driven Dad
about:
As young as 4 years old, I always wanted to be a farmer, because they grow stuff from nothing. And while I didn‚Äôt become a farmer in the literal sense, my intrinsic desire to make things grow, whether that be a business or an individual‚Äôs career, is still very much alive. In fact, this, combined with a desire to take risks and to push things where they‚Äôve never been before, is what fuels me.
 
I‚Äôm a serial entrepreneur who‚Äôs started and sold four companies. Most recently Jet.com, which sold to Walmart for $3.3 billion in 2016 and prior to that, Diapers.com/Quidsi which sold to Amazon in 2011 for $550 million.
 
As an entrepreneur, I‚Äôve learned how to build a mission-driven culture, prioritize the customer value proposition, build great teams and empower them to move fast to get stuff done. I‚Äôm a mercenary turned missionary. Because of this, I‚Äôm passionate about helping other founders make sense of the startup world, because I know from experience it can be difficult to navigate.
 
On LinkedIn I write about things that are top of mind and lessons I‚Äôve learned along the way ‚Äì ranging from leadership and culture, to funding and scaling, and how companies both large and small can benefit from a startup mindset. I also host Startup Standup, a series where I mentor and advise female founders who are preparing to secure their first (or next!) round of institutional funding.

Media / Speaking Inquiries: please contact Adam Schiff from CultureSpeed Communications (adam@culturespeed.com)

name: Andrew Singletary
title: Co-founder and CEO at 3Laws Robotics | Caltech PhD | Forbes 30 Under 30
about:
From automating child seat fitment tests at General Motors to completing my thesis on "Safe Input Regulation for Robotic Systems" at Caltech, I have focused on intelligent safety solutions for robotic systems. Now, I've started 3Laws Robotics to provide companies the tools they need to safely and reliably deploy high-performance robotic systems.

I have a broad set of experiences with localization, perception, planning, and control for a wide variety of robotic systems including cars, boats, drones, manipulators, legged robots, and more. I have developed and deployed software (primarily C and C++) on hard real-time systems.

I completed my PhD in the AMBER lab at Caltech. My specialization is safety-critical control of robotic systems, utilizing nonlinear control theory to provide safety guarantees for robots in the real world. I published 30+ research papers on this topic, and was nominated for 3 Best Paper Awards.

name: Jean-Pierre Trou
title: CEO & Founder at mbue | Techstars 23‚Äô, Founding Principal at Runa Workshop
about:
Jean Pierre Trou is a Peruvian-American tech entrepreneur and award-winning architect known for his boundless creativity and innovative spirit. With a profound passion for design and a keen eye for technological advancements, he has founded and led multiple companies that shared a common vision of improving the built environment. 

Jean Pierre is the CEO and co-founder of mbue, a pioneering SaaS AI-First company that is transforming the construction industry. mbue is a web-based application that utilizes Artificial Intelligence to instantly review architectural drawings. Think ‚Äúautocorrect‚Äù for construction documents. It saves significant time and money, while reducing liability exposure. By automating the quality control process mbue enables architects and builders to focus on doing their most impactful work.

Furthermore, Jean Pierre is the Founding Principal of Runa Workshop, an award winning architecture and interior design firm recognized for its exceptional design solution on complex projects. Additionally, he serves as a Founding Partner at Vaast, a dynamic real estate development company.

Jean Pierre holds an undergraduate degree in Architecture from the Universidad Peruana de Ciencias Aplicadas (UPC) in Lima, Peru. Further honing his craft, he earned a Masters of Architecture in Design and Theory from the prestigious University of Texas at Austin School of Architecture.

Jean Pierre lives in Austin, Texas, where he has built a loving and fulfilling life with his wonderful wife, their two amazing kids, and two very cute dogs.

name: Mary-Queenie Adam
title: Founder, CEO @ Trends Research
about:
I co-founded Trends Research with a mission to provide difficult-to-get data to global brands about their own brand but also that of their competitors. 

Our platform empowers multinational companies with the actionable business intelligence they need to thrive in emerging markets. Some global brands are using our platform to determine locations for expansion or where to invest to boost their competitiveness. Others are looking for new markets that are growing and have good demographics ‚Äî regions where they can start establishing themselves to be able to capture future sales.

Imagine the possibilities for a retail brand that can precisely identify its competitor's customers, understand their preferences, and directly reach out to them with tailored offers. Or envision a startup that can quickly gain insights into its target market's behaviors and effectively engage potential customers through targeted SMS campaigns. Our business intelligence platform unlocks these opportunities and more.

If you‚Äôre looking to expand your reach and drive revenue in the MENA region, Indian Ocean, Nigeria and Kenya and South Africa, I‚Äôd love to hear from you! Please reach out to me on maryqueenie@trendsresearch.ai and let‚Äôs revolutionise the way you access and utilize data and target customers directly.
speaking_engagements: Speaker at USAfricaBizSummit 2024; Speaker at Africa Fintech Summit 2024
notable_achievements: Co-founded an AI-backed business intelligence SaaS platform impacting MENA and African markets

name: Dan Di Federico
title: Leadership Marketing for Advisory firms | trends.ceo
about:
Executives are under pressure to become "thought leaders." Most are up to the challenge, but the last thing they want to be is mediocre, and they lack the time and resources to become world-class.

At the same time, Chief Marketing Officers envision vibrant social media channels with strong executive insights, but they struggle to scale support across multiple leaders. 

I started trends.ceo to solve this. After a career leading social media departments for organizations like KPMG and Philips, I saw this same problem time and again.

trends.ceo helps executives build their reputation as social media thought leaders. Through our Leadership Marketing Program, we partner with their marketing teams, analyze their competitors, define their unique positioning, and produce targeted, high-impact video series.

Since launching in 2022, we've supported dozens of C-suite and senior partners in billion-dollar firms. Our clients have shared powerful testimonials, including peer recognition, speaking opportunities, reputation improvement, and new revenue for their firms.

If you're ready to turn your leadership bench into your strongest marketing channel, let's talk.

name: David Hosei
title: Director Of E-Commerce at Trends International
about:
I am an E-Commerce end-to-end operator with a long history of growing and developing brands on the Internet. 

I successfully exited in 2006 from 3GUPLOAD.COM, an Internet start-up that I co-founded in 2003 that focused on providing ringtones, screen-savers, and games to over 500,000 paid mobile phone subscribers. We had $8 million in annual recurring revenue and 40 employees when the company was acquired.

Shortly afterwards, I founded eFamily.com, a passion project with the goal of providing families an online destination to connect in a safe, secure and meaningful way. Launched in 2007, the site usage grew to over 30,000 registered families. In 2013, we announced the acquisition of Origami Labs' software platform. Our goal was to build a sustainable organization that helps family connect in a secure and private place online.  eFamily was acquired by the largest competitor in the space by subscriber count in 2015.

In 2008, I invested in a startup Posters2Prints.com and helped the business grow from 2009 to 2013. In late 2013, I became the CEO of Posters 2 Prints, LLC. The company's mission was to delight our customers with exceptional custom framed art and mirrors at the most affordable price.  Posters 2 Prints LLC was sold in 2021.

In 2016, I entered a new season of my career.  Leveraging the skills and experience I gained over the past decade I joined Fusion Alliance.  I acquired skills and developed great relationships at Fusion. 

In late 2017, leveraging my experience with web-based businesses and managing teams -- I was fortunate to be hired at Trends International LLC as the Senior Manager of eCommerce.  I was promoted to the Director of E-Commerce in 2021.  The team I lead generates 8-figures of Net Revenue per year and we‚Äôre growing consistently year-over-year. According to SmartScout, Trends International is the #1 brand in the Posters & Prints subcategory on Amazon.com in terms of monthly revenue.  In 2023, we completed the acquisition of Art.com and Allposters.com to continue expanding our product offering and presence online. I am excited to work with a great team to help Trends continue to develop and prosper.

Overall, I am truly blessed with the opportunities and experiences I have been a part of over the years. I'm truly excited for the next stage of my career and the relationships I will build in the coming years.
speaking_engagements: Spoke about the importance of having an entrepreneurial mindset at the 2023 Launch Fishers High School Fellowship Bootcamp
notable_achievements: Principal and Methodology Lead at Zeroth Labs, focusing on public sector innovation and social policy; Asia21 Young Leader, Asia Society
reasoning: David Hosei demonstrates a clear pattern of successful entrepreneurship with multiple small-to-medium exits and operational experience. His track record includes founding and exiting three companies (3GUPLOAD.COM, eFamily.com, and involvement in Posters2Prints), with at least one documented revenue figure ($8M ARR for 3GUPLOAD.COM). His exits appear to be in the $10M-$100M range based on company scale, though exact figures aren't provided. name: Christopher Samaras
title: 10x Growth Enabler - Single Source Managed Mobility Services | Helping Companies Simplify Mobile Device Deployments | Scale Faster & Reduce Costs | #MobilityBetter | Entrepreneur With A Book On A Bike
location: King of Prussia, Pennsylvania, United States
about:
Since the age of 8, I've been a serial entrepreneur who has successfully run numerous businesses. Back in 2006, I transitioned my career from an analyst in pharma to the wireless space after my mom broke her cell phone.

For the past 17+ years, I have utilized the relationships I've built and my passion in technology to make the world better by helping consumers and organizations solve problems in the wireless space. Through my oversight, I've been responsible for the deployment of millions of devices and providing consumers and companies well over $1 billion in cost savings. Among these millions of devices, the majority of them were repurposed from the secondary market and utilized for purpose base use cases, preventing countless tons of Eco-waste.

In 2014, ConnectUs was born. The vision then is the same as it is today ‚Äî to simplify the mobility deployment process and help businesses do mobility better. We, together as a team, are working to build a world class company that helps thousands of organizations overcome digital transformation challenges.

Our customers‚Äô achievements include thousands of healthier patients, millions of active schoolchildren and a more agile electoral process. All of this drives us to reach for more. We‚Äôre thrilled when brands on a tight schedule beat product deadlines or a company scales up fast to meet explosive demand.

Our Mission: As a single source provider of Managed Mobility Services, enable our customers growth by helping them do #MobilityBetter. 

Take touch intensive mobile deployment tasks off your hands. Focus on core missions & growth instead. 

I am extremely proud of what we have built until now. I‚Äôm even more excited by what is to come.

name: Carey Anne Nadeau
title: Co-CEO at LOOP
about:
Carey Anne Nadeau is the Co-Founder and Co-CEO of LOOP, a car insurance agency that makes it their business to serve the underserved, including people who have no or low credit. Using data in novel ways, LOOP is capitalizing on industry-wide mis-pricing, delivering an affordable and dignified experience to its members. 

Carey believes that by using data we can reveal and correct for institutionalized bias, supporting smart policy making and building big businesses in the blind spot of legacy financial services institutions. 

She‚Äôs been chipping away at this problem for 15 years, founding multiple companies, becoming a vocal advocate for justice and equality, and being a thought leader in the smart cities and open data movements. 

Carey honed her craft at premier research and academic institutions ‚Äì the Brookings Institution and the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT), where she holds a Research Affiliate appointment and a Master‚Äôs Degree from the Dept of Urban Studies and Planning. She‚Äôs been published in books, articles, and won national awards for her cutting-edge work using geospatial statistics to have honest conversations about the living wage and the importance of mobility.

name: Zelia M. Drumm
title: Founder | Zelia | Co-Founder | Unfragile Farm | Visionary, Believer & Manifester
about:
I‚Äôm the founder of Zelia, home of Compassionate Self-Archeology‚Äîa healing-centered practice that invites people to explore, discover, and restore their authentic selves. At Unfragile Farm, I‚Äôm co-creating a visionary trauma healing and social justice retreat center with Alphonso James, a living example of resilience and love after 32 years of wrongful incarceration. Together, we‚Äôre building a place where healing isn‚Äôt just a service‚Äîit‚Äôs a way of life.

My work is rooted in a simple but radical truth: we are all born whole. Beneath the layers of pain, survival, and adaptation, our true selves remain intact. Healing isn‚Äôt about fixing what‚Äôs broken‚Äîit‚Äôs about reconnecting with what‚Äôs always been there.

For over three decades, I‚Äôve been at the forefront of transforming how we respond to trauma, violence, and injustice. As the founding executive director of the Alma Center, I helped pioneer Healing Focused Care, a national model for working with men who use violence‚Äîshifting from punishment to compassionate accountability, and from a culture of disposability to one of possibility.

I believe people heal in connection, not correction. Whether it‚Äôs guiding individuals through inner landscapes, transforming systems that harm, or designing spaces for collective restoration, I hold the deepest faith in our capacity to heal, grow, and begin again.

Let‚Äôs connect if you‚Äôre passionate about healing, justice, and building bold alternatives to broken systems.
notable_achievements: Secretary and Ritual, Chapter No. 1, Dallas, Texas, 1915

name: Kyle Connors
title: ceo + cofounder @ candidate.fyi | schedule interviews faster with AI
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
I‚Äôm building candidate.fyi - the AI coordination engine modernizing how companies hire.

Scheduling interviews is a huge part of what we do, but it‚Äôs just the start. We‚Äôre building the infrastructure that supports seamless coordination across the hiring process, empowering teams to focus on high-impact moments with candidates.

Before this, I led engineering teams and built software used by millions. But I always wanted to start something of my own - something that tackled a problem with real human impact.

Hiring always stood out to me. I‚Äôve hired dozens of people over the years, and I‚Äôve seen firsthand how important the interview process is - where impressions are formed, decisions are made, and careers can change. It‚Äôs one of the most critical moments for both candidates and employers - and yet, it‚Äôs often where things break down.

So in 2022, I left my job - mortgage in hand, two kids at home (now three) - to launch a startup with my brother. We went all in.

Since then, we‚Äôve grown candidate.fyi into the platform powering the hiring experience for teams at Discord, Intercom, GoPro, Ballys, and more. We‚Äôve out-shipped companies 10x our size - and earned every customer along the way.

I‚Äôm obsessed with customer experience. I still run onboarding calls myself, listen to every pain point, and make sure we ship the best product possible.

We‚Äôre still early - but we‚Äôre building something big.
