name: Adam Watson, PhD
title: CEO at MeCo Diagnostics | Board Director at American Cancer Society
about:
I'm a cancer biologist building tools to support a new modality of high-value, low-toxicity cancer treatments, including the first clinically validated predictive biomarker test for antifibrotic therapy. 

While I was in grad school, my aunt was diagnosed with advanced cancer. Despite having "excellent" health insurance, her treatments cost over $100K in out-of-pocket expenses. Even the best health insurance is not the shield we expect it to be when we need it the most, for one heartbreaking reason: families of patients with advanced cancer are often driven by desperation to seek out non-reimbursable treatments when all else has failed, only to find themselves drowning in debt in the wake of grief and loss.

Cancer isn‚Äôt just a health problem‚Äîit‚Äôs a growing economic problem. Expensive new therapies are merely transforming the former into the latter, since cancer debts can now outlive cancer patients by years or decades. 

Unbelievably, the price for newly launched oncology drugs is now over $260,000/year, up from $64,000/year in 2012. 

This is outrageous. 

As a result, payers are under pressure and passing along the cost to patients‚Äînearly half of American patients with advanced breast cancer are currently being chased by debt collectors due to mounting medical debt. 

Fortunately, the MeCo Score was recently validated as the first predictive biomarker test for breast cancer to harness an FDA-approved, generic-emergent antifibrotic drug, which will soon cost pennies on the dollar compared to any other targeted therapy for breast cancer. Moreover, it is well-tolerated by patients and has a favorable safety profile.

In our landmark Phase 2 trial, High MeCo Score patients who received antifibrotic therapy vs standard-of-care therapy alone experienced a 62% reduction in risk of recurrence over 9.7 years on average. 

This stunning result is unprecedented in early-stage breast cancer. 

Patients who may benefit can only be matched using the MeCo Score test, which has been evaluated in 4 studies comprised of nearly 4000 patients, in collaboration with Cleveland Clinic, Mayo Clinic, George Washington University, UArizona, and the Spanish National Cancer Research Center. 

Our enabling research has been published in high-impact journals: Cell, Science, Cancer Cell, Cell Reports, Nature Communications, Clinical Cancer Research, etc.

We are venture-backed and harness 100+ years of combined experience in diagnostics and therapeutics. 

Join our mission to save patients‚Äô lives and livelihoods, simultaneously. 

Send us a message to learn more.
experience_3_company: American Cancer Society National Breast Cancer Roundtable

notable_achievements: Co-invented the MeCo Score, a predictive biomarker test for breast cancer patients; Published a landmark 10-year study in Clinical Cancer Research on antifibrotic therapy for breast cancer; Developed technology behind MeCo Diagnostics during graduate and postdoctoral work; Holds patents on prognostic and predictive biomarkers for breast cancer
reasoning: Adam Watson demonstrates strong technical and scientific credentials with significant research impact in oncology. name: Cyrus Neek
title: Co-founder & CTO/CPO @ ‚ôæxBlock | Techstars'23 Future of Food | WTIA | 1871 AI Innovation Lab | Transforming the Future of Work
about:
I've been an entrepreneur all of the time in my years of work, with only slight digressions to teach. Each of these new ventures was an adventure for me. I followed them with an insatiable devotion to the topic at hand. I thrive as a problem solver, relishing the opportunity to turn obstacles into opportunities. My passions rest in addressing human challenges with the latest technology, and system building feels like putting together a complicated puzzle. Sensitive work, rewarding, and always looking for the next piece to fit in with the vision that is constantly growing. 

I have enjoyed opportunities to work collaboratively and have had the privilege of amazing working partners across many sectors, as clients and colleagues. All of these experiences have solidly taught me the value of thoughtful planning and the power that comes from living by the philosophies of "Give First" and "See Something, Do Something." The endless search and never-quit attitudes towards finding new technologies and ideas developed my passion for innovation and lifelong learning. 

As an Iranian-American, I truly value the freedoms and opportunities that the United States offers, making it not just the ultimate place for entrepreneurs but also a fantastic place to live. This deep appreciation has motivated my co-founder and me to give back to this generous country through our latest project. We're focusing on the hospitality industry·Ö≥America's second-largest employer with approximately 15 million workers·Ö≥to enhance work environments and improve the well-being of employees and managers. My co-founder and I view this project as our way of contributing to our homeland and to this generous nation that has given us so much. 

My wife and I love spending time with the kids outside work: adventures, games, and just simple time together. I consider myself incredibly fortunate not only to share my life with my love but also to work alongside her as my co-founder and best friend. Over the past 21 years, we've built everything together, experiencing life doubly enriched by our partnership.

about:
I‚Äôm an AI engineer with an MBA in organizational psychology and behavior, and I‚Äôve been building companies since 2002‚Äîincluding three exits in 2012 and 2013. After relocating to the U.S., I spent nearly a decade working closely with multi-unit businesses‚Äîparticularly in hospitality‚Äîhelping them scale and streamline operations through custom software.

That experience exposed a recurring challenge: when businesses grow fast or go through acquisitions, critical knowledge gets lost. That‚Äôs why we built xBlock‚Äîto capture and preserve institutional knowledge before it walks out the door. We help businesses prepare for exit, reduce buyer risk, and ensure smoother leadership transitions‚Äîwithout relying on manual documentation.

Outside of work, I live by the principles of playing and curiosity. I believe in applying systems thinking‚Äîunderstanding that everything is interconnected, shaped by feedback loops, and often nonlinear. Small shifts can create massive ripple effects, and I‚Äôm constantly exploring the emergent properties of complex systems. Whether I‚Äôm playing with words in poems or pushing the boundaries of my mental models‚Äîthose ingrained assumptions that frame how we see the world‚ÄîI‚Äôm always looking to challenge my perspective. From practicing limitless thinking with my kids to embracing systems that influence leadership, I‚Äôm an advocate for respectful parenting and holistic problem-solving.

name: William (Bill) Mobley
title: Originator of Streaming TV, TMT Futurist, CEO@FreeCastTV,  @SelectTV, @StreamingTVKit @RabbitTV fmr MegaChannels.TV (circa 1998), 30yr Tech Entrepreneur.
about:
William (Bill) Mobley is a trailblazer in the media industry, known for his commitment to pioneering digital solutions that revolutionize content delivery and consumption. With over 25 years of experience, Bill has consistently led the charge in digital media, fostering growth through strategic partnerships and cutting-edge technologies, including his latest venture, FreeCast.  FreeCast and its leaders have consistently demonstrated an ability to anticipate industry trends. The company‚Äôs products and major features have all been built not for the media industry‚Äôs present state, but rather, in anticipation of where it‚Äôs headed. These forward-thinking decisions have put FreeCast in position to capitalize on the trends that are otherwise disruptive to other companies, large and small, in the media industry.

FreeCast has undertaken what has now been more than a ten-year project because there are reasons why such a product must be built from the ground up. The incumbent media empires and tech giants have too much interest to serve as the agnostic aggregators that are necessary for the entire industry to come together in a single market. FreeCast has, since its inception, strived to be this neutral party in order to create that common marketplace where all content providers, big and small, can offer their content. This remains something that even the largest companies, willing to invest billions, cannot do.

As the founder of several successful media enterprises, Bill's achievements include introducing commercial no-download/app-required streaming technology, which remains widely used by tens of millions of people daily to consume a wide range of videos from streaming to mobile devices.

His company, MegaMedia Networks, launched MegaChannels.com/tv in 1999‚Äîthe first movie and TV streaming portal on the internet, seven years before Netflix, inclusive of Warner Bros, Miramax, Paramount, and various studio's libraries. MegaChannels featured a diverse range of content, including movies like Top Gun, Enemy of State, Deep Impact, Twister, and TV shows such as Happy Days and The Wonder Years. At its peak in 2000, MegaChannels.com/tv attracted over 800K viewers daily, showcasing the power of media aggregation at a time when Yahoo was handling around 4-5 million searches a day.

Throughout his career, he has been dedicated to driving innovation, building strong relationships, and leading teams to exceptional results. His work is fueled by a deep belief in collaboration and a commitment to staying ahead in an ever-evolving industry.
speaking_engagements: Speaker at NAB Show 2025
notable_achievements: Founder and former president of World Commerce, a successful Internet business
reasoning: Bill Mobley demonstrates characteristics of a Market Innovator and Thought Leader (L6) based on his pioneering work in streaming technology and media aggregation. He created MegaChannels.com in 1999, which was genuinely innovative for its time, predating Netflix's streaming service by 7 years. The scale of his achievements (800K daily viewers in 2000 when Yahoo had 4-5M searches/day) and partnerships with major studios (Warner Bros, Miramax, Paramount) show significant market impact. His current venture FreeCast continues to demonstrate innovation in media aggregation. While there's no clear evidence of billion-dollar exits that would qualify for L7+, his consistent pattern of innovation and industry influence strongly supports an L6 classification.

name: Jitesh Shetty
title: Founder/CEO Credibl | Co-Founder Qwiklabs(acquired by Google) | Co-Founder MR Access| Investor in 17 tech startups
about:
I am the Founder/CEO of Credibl - a native AI full stack platform for decarbonisation-ESG data management and supply chain traceability and due-diligence. I am a serial technology entrepreneur and before Credibl I founded a cloud computing labs company Qwiklabs which I sold to Google. I am also an investor in 17+ AI and deep tech companies.

Credibl:

* Native AI full stack decarbonisation-ESG, supply chain traceability and due-diligence platform used by 100+ enterprises around the world.
* We have several customers in the circular plastics value chain including iconic companies like Schoeller Allibert. 
* We give every enterprise an AI virtual auditor to solve the ‚Äúgarbage in and garbage out‚Äù problem - this enables at scale compliance for customers like Flipkart(Walmart company) across thousands of warehouses and complex supply chains. 
* We track 1.2 Billion finished units on our traceability platform and support Digital Product Passport, Corporate Sustainability Due Diligence Directive, EUDR and CBAM. 
* We are leaders in hospitality - IHCL has deployed the platform across all Taj hotels including Ginger and TajSats. 
* We are leaders in the textile value chain with iconic companies like Welspun, Eco Fashion Corp and IndoCount tracking their entire supply chain and operational ESG on our platform.

Qwiklabs:

* I founded Qwiklabs in Boston in 2012, it is a hands-on labs experience at scale for software professionals. Google acquired the company in 2016. 
* Our proprietary patented authoring platform enables technical authors(SWEs, SREs, hands-on architects, devops engineers) to author and test lab development code and lab assessment code. * Our proprietary patented student platform creates a state of the art learning and assessment experience. 
* We built a large B2B and a B2C business. The B2B business is a SAAS style business and the B2C business is a subscription based business. 
* Enterprise customers included Amazon, Nvidia, Red Hat Storage, Global Knowledge, QA.

MR Access:

* I am a Co-Founder and Board Member at MR Access - a native AI portable MRI company. We reduce both the CapEx and OpEx of operating a MRI - with a novel integrated(software+hardware) system design. Our magnet does not require helium for cooling.  
* MR Access has been founded by pioneers in the radiology and healthcare AI space. 

I have invested in over 17+ AI companies including Avoma, TravelX, ODDR, RupeeBoss. In grad school at USC in Los Angeles I did some early AI research on the enron email dataset https://dl.acm.org/doi/10.1145/1134271.1134282

name: Keaun Amani
title: Founder & Chief Executive Officer at Neurosnap Inc.
about:
Neurosnap Inc. is a biotech startup that aims to develop cutting-edge technologies that bridge the gap between biology and machine learning. As the founder and CEO, I lead a talented team of engineers, scientists, and researchers who share my passion for this intersectional field. 

My career began as a software engineer, accumulating nearly a decade's worth of experience in data science, algorithm development, and software design. I then pivoted towards synthetic biology, where I applied my computational skills to solve biological problems. Some of my most proud accomplishments include developing new algorithms for predicting enzyme stability and activity, and successfully genetically engineering plants to glow in the dark. 

My professional journey has taught me that the most rewarding endeavors are those that challenge the status quo and push the boundaries of innovation. I look forward to continuing this spirit at Neurosnap Inc., where we are constantly exploring new ways to leverage the power of machine learning and biology to create novel solutions for the world.

name: Tom Kinyanjui Njoroge
title: Impacting Healthcare using AI | Innovator | Africa Oxford Initiative Fellow ‚Äò25 University of Oxford | Business Daily Africa Top 40 under 40 ‚Äò24 | Catalyst Fund '24 | UNICEF Innovation Fund '23 | AI4H Villgro Africa '23
about:
I am a passionate entrepreneur with a strong interest in leveraging technology to solve some of Africa's most pressing challenges. I grew up in Nairobi, Kenya, and witnessed firsthand the struggles that many people face in accessing quality healthcare. This experience ignited a passion in me to pursue a career in technology and now HealthTech.

I studied Machine Learning in Data Science. During my studies, I discovered the power of artificial intelligence (AI) and its potential to revolutionize healthcare in Africa.

With this newfound knowledge, I founded a startup that leverages AI to screen medical images. My startup Neural Labs Africa is focused on developing an AI-powered diagnostic tool that can accurately identify diseases from medical images, such as X-rays, CT scans, and MRIs. This tool has the potential to significantly improve the speed and accuracy of diagnoses, particularly in resource-constrained settings.

My passion for healthcare and technology has not gone unnoticed. Neural Labs Africa has received several awards and recognition, including being named one of the top 10 healthcare startups in Africa. In addition, I have been invited to speak at various healthcare and technology conferences across the continent.

Despite the challenges of running a startup in Africa, I remain committed to my mission of using technology to improve healthcare outcomes. I hope to continue to grow my startup and expand its reach to more people in need of quality healthcare across the continent.
education_1_degree: Executive Fellowship in Health Innovation and Entrepreneurship
speaking_engagements: Featured in AI4H program supported by Villgro Africa, discussing AI technologies for healthcare
notable_achievements: Co-founded Neural Labs Africa, a company transforming healthcare through AI diagnostics
reasoning: Tom Kinyanjui Njoroge shows characteristics of an early-stage entrepreneur with promising traction and recognition, but is still in the growth phase of his first significant venture. name: Hynek Kasl
title: Co-founder | Director of Engineering | Crafting the future of biotech with ML
about:
I am a life sciences entrepreneur and engineer working at the crossroads of synthetic biology, machine learning, and biotech.

Since childhood, I have been mesmerized by modern life sciences, building a strong foundation in physics, chemistry, and molecular biology.

In academia, I applied my analytical skills to machine learning and industrial control engineering. During my B.Sc., I fell in love with synthetic biology and genetic engineering. Since then, I've focused on applying classical engineering and data science to design novel biological systems.

With a fresh M.Sc., I co-founded a deep-tech startup, a biotech company focused on revolutionizing single-cell measurement for healthcare and drug development. As the founding member and leader of the engineering team, my research has encompassed:

-Genetic engineering of yeast and bacteria, fine-tuning a multitude of cellular functions to comprise a functional particle, from nucleus to cell wall.
-De-novo protein engineering, from design using computational tools, through purification to characterization in the lab.
-Applying LLMs and other ML tools to large-scale databases to enable molecular biological innovation.
-Designing multicellular networks based on reinforcement learning and other data-driven approaches.
-Discovery of biologic activators, inhibitors, and effectors of GPCRs using an in-house pipeline.
-Collection of single-cell NGS data, curation, and processing with various machine learning algorithms.
-Establishing robust fermentation and pilot-scale manufacturing for genetically engineered microbes.

In every project, I strive to use my broad interdisciplinary intuition and put my natural inclination towards mathematics and algorithms to good use.
experience_3_company: NTIS ‚Äì New Technologies for the Information Society
reasoning: Hynek Kasl appears to be an early-stage technical founder with strong academic credentials and about 3-4 years of startup experience. name: Morgan Duffy Tregenza
title: Founder & CEO at levelheaded
about:
I'm a retired attorney and mediator with a deep passion for helping people resolve disputes with accessibility and ease. At levelheaded I am dedicated to creating the world‚Äôs most easy-to-use  and prolific conflict resolution platform. The mission is simple and big: to make the world a less litigious place. 

Before starting levelheaded, I was an attorney and early on in my legal career I fell into mediation. When I told my legal clients their case would almost always settle, I realized that working to that ultimate outcome from the get-go was much more efficient, affordable and the best part is that everyone got to move on with their lives. I started mediating for my local city courts and fell in love with helping people resolve their disputes quickly and with great satisfaction. I spent years honing my mediation skills for the courts, for businesses and individuals who knew their was a much better way. I was mentored (and still am) by international experts, colleagues, Professors, and Judges - and today I dedicate my spare time coaching in mediation certification classes.   For many years I ran my own mediation practice, which eventually evolved into some of the inspiration behind our innovative platform. As an entrepreneur, I am always creating ‚Äî I've written children's books and designed, developed and launched a photobook app for busy families.

I am a self proclaimed mediation nerd, and recently finished my term as the President of the Mediation Association of Colorado. In this role, I helped to set and execute a vision to make mediation readily available in the State of Colorado. It was a great privilege to lead an organization that has the power to shape how mediation is conducted throughout the state. Additionally, I worked on the legislative committee to testify in the Legislature in advocating for mediation as an accessible and viable option for resolving disputes. Today, my energy and time is focused on being the CEO and founder of levelheaded as we look to the future where my dreams of making conflict resolution accessible to all are fully being realized.

name: Anatoly Volkhover
title: Technology Executive ‚¶Å Software Architect and Developer ‚¶Å Engineering Productivity Expert ‚¶Å Author of, Become an Awesome Software Architect
about:
With three decades of hands-on experience in Silicon Valley, I specialize in crafting robust, enterprise-level software architectures enriched with Artificial Intelligence. I've had the privilege of developing bespoke solutions for an array of well-known brands, including Pepsi, Nestl√©, Gatorade, Hitachi, L'Or√©al, FOX, Millennium Entertainment, Travelocity, DERTour, and Robert Mondavi, among others. The longevity of my work speaks volumes; many solutions created over twenty years ago remain operational today, underscoring their resilience and adaptability.

Having built technology for countless startups, I intimately understand the challenges of operating under severely constrained time and budget. To succeed, I invented methodologies and tools that significantly expedite development, zero out early-stage costs, and eradicate expensive overhauls downstream. My insights have been encapsulated in my 2019 book, "Become an Awesome Software Architect," a go-to grimoire in enterprise software architecture (www.amazon.com/dp/B087M96JTF).

To make my methods and tools widely available, I began designing an AI-driven platform that delivers highly reliable software in a fraction of the conventional time and cost. This work became the cornerstone of RISHON AI, a company I founded to empower entrepreneurs to rapidly and affordably turn their ideas into fully functional, high-quality products. At RISHON, we leverage my three-decade repository of knowledge and inventions to realign software engineering with core business imperatives. Learn more at rishon.com.

I'm also involved in Prophecta, an enterprise optimization platform delivering cost-efficiency, safety, and environmental benefits for vehicle fleets, supply chains, construction, and manufacturing. Discover how we're making an impact at prophecta.com.

I invite you to connect with me here on LinkedIn to explore potential synergies.

Dr. Elsa Jungman has made significant contributions to the fields of skin health and microbiome innovation. With a Ph.D. in skin barrier function, she has an extensive background working with leading companies such as L'Or√©al, K18, and AOBiome. Dr. Jungman's research into the skin microbiome led her to recognize it as the future of the consumer health and beauty industry, inspiring her to start her own company focused on leveraging microbiome data to drive innovation in consumer solutions.
In late 2020, she launched her namesake pioneering microbiome-friendly skincare line, followed by a unique direct-to-consumer microbiome test kit in retail outlets such as Credo Beauty and with the facial bar FaceHaus. By 2022, Dr. Jungman introduced HelloBiome, a B2B AI platform utilizing microbiome data for personal care innovation, clinical research, and personalization. Her contributions have been recognized with the French-American Entrepreneurship Award. Additionally, she is the editor of the fifth edition of the "Handbook of Cosmetic Science and Technology," further establishing her as a leader in her field.
She currently lives in San Francisco with her family.

name: Chris Nichols
title: Leadership and Talent Advisor
about:
I am an experienced leadership advisor that has worked with CEOs, Investors and Boards at leading Private Equity Firms and Fortune 500 companies to improve company performance through informed talent decisions, coaching and development of leaders and improved organizational effectiveness.   I bring a strategy and operational focus to engagements, leveraging firsthand experience running a Private Equity owned company, leading corporate strategy efforts, and integrating a Fortune 500 merger.  My work starts with a deep understanding of an organization‚Äôs strategy and value creation thesis and then tailors support to optimize the talent, leadership and organization to achieve the future goals of the company.   I relate with leaders based on my personal experience in operational roles and bring a strong focus on supporting others to achieve results.   

I am also focused on driving innovation in the talent and leadership development space.   I enjoy connecting with others that are looking to collaborate.   

A Former ghSMART Partner, President of PE backed company, Fortune 500 strategy executive and McKinsey consultant, I bring a unique set of experiences and expertise.  My work typically supports organizations across a number of talent, organizational and leadership needs, including:
- Improving confidence in talent decisions 
- Mitigating talent or organization risk tied to not having the optimal team
- Developing talent plans to optimize leadership team and company performance towards a forward-looking strategy or deal thesis 
- Identifying the most impactful key roles to achieve goals
- Accelerating performance of critical and high potential leaders
- Making organizational changes (org structure, decision rights, working norms) to improve performance or scale a business
- Optimizing performance or effectiveness of a team (leadership team, Board of Directors, etc.)
- Improving alignment on organizational priorities 

I customize solutions to the need of a leader or organization. Typical services include:   
- Executive leadership assessment (individual hiring decisions, leadership team diligence)
- Organizational diagnostic assessment and design
- CEO and C-suite succession and development
- Leadership coaching
- Performance management
- Role based priority & metrics development 
- Team effectiveness coaching
- Board evaluation

name: Arshak Avoyan
title: üö¢  product for 10+ years
about:
Currently working with Business Intelligence and Data Infrastructure teams to democratize data at Picsart. Providing insights from for more than 150 Million monthly active users. Passionate about product, data and experimentation.

My journey at Picsart started in Product Management, where I was leading our Growth team. Our goal was to improve app retention and at first, when the team was small, we were concentrated on lowest hanging fruits - fixing UX/UI issues, providing some simple onboarding, improving the current registration flow. 

As our team scaled, I undertook more challenging project, including end-to-end onboarding and the transformation to required registration. Both were super important yet very sensitive projects, as Picsart already had tens of millions of monthly users and I had to be super careful with their experience. After launching close to 100 experiments, we were able to increase the number of our registered users by almost 400% and increase our retention by 15%. 

After a few years as a PM, Picsart had started to grow so fast, that we felt the need of having a dedicated Business Intelligence team to that would help the company make the right decisions. At that time, I was managing 50+ people in 3 teams(Growth, Share and Lifecycle), but my interest in data was so strong, that I completely dedicated myself to our new data department, and started to scale the team and operations. 

Currently, there are close to 40 people in our BI unit(up from 3 when I started), who are embedded in our cross-functional product units. We provide insights, define KPIs, do deep-dives, analyze AB test results, prepare dashboards and work with Product team to shape roadmap.

I also work with Data Infrastructure team, where we are responsible for data storage and access, feature flagging, internal AB testing tool, internal analytics tools and much more. This teams serves as the pillar for all data operations at Picsart and our goal is to make data accessible to all stakeholders. During past year, we have successfully completed major projects, including

- Full transition from on-premise infrastructure to complete cloud based solution using Databricks+AWS.
- Implemented new generation of house-made AB testing tool that can run 1000+ tests simultaneously while updating results near real time 
- Scaled the infrastructure to support Picsart's growth, now handling terabytes of data per day and hundreds of users. 
-Implemented self-service data platforms via Looker and Tableau
speaking_engagements: Featured in Comcast NBCUniversal LIFT Labs startup story; Recognized by Ministry of High-Tech Industry of the Republic of Armenia

I love figuring out complex problems and devising strategies to scale.

name: Marc Benioff
title: Chair & CEO at Salesforce
about:
Marc Benioff is Chair, Chief Executive Officer and Co-Founder of Salesforce and a pioneer of cloud computing. Under Benioff's leadership, Salesforce has become the third-largest enterprise software company and the largest enterprise applications company in the world.

Benioff was named ‚ÄúInnovator of the Decade‚Äù by Forbes and is recognized as one of the World‚Äôs 25 Greatest Leaders by Fortune, one of the 10 Best-Performing CEOs by Harvard Business Review, as the CNN Business CEO of 2020 and Chief Executive Magazine's 2022 CEO of the Year. He was named a ‚ÄúChevalier de la L√©gion d‚Äôhonneur,‚Äù one of France's most prestigious awards for an individual, in recognition of Salesforce‚Äôs longstanding relationship with France and support to French Polynesia during the pandemic. Benioff received both the Yale Legend in Leadership Award and the Colin Powell Distinguished Leadership Award in 2024. He has been awarded a Society for Progress Medal for courageous leadership in integrating business performance and societal progress. In 2019, Benioff was elected a member of the National Academy of Engineering. For his leadership on equality, Benioff has been honored by GLAAD, the Billie Jean King Leadership Initiative and Variety Magazine with its EmPOWerment Award. In 2020, he and his wife, Lynne, received a George H.W. Bush Points of Light Award for their civic engagement.

Benioff founded Salesforce in 1999, and it is now a Fortune 150 company with 70,000+ employees, guided by five core values ‚Äî trust, customer success, innovation, equality and sustainability. The company has been recognized as the Most Innovative Company by Forbes, a Best Place to Work by Fortune, and the 10th Most Admired Company in the World by Fortune.

Building a different kind of company, Benioff created Salesforce to not only develop great products, but also to have a positive impact on the world. On day 1, Benioff created the 1-1-1 model of philanthropy, committing 1% of Salesforce‚Äôs equity, product and employee time to the community since the company‚Äôs founding 25 years ago. He also co-founded the Pledge 1% movement. Today, more than 20,000 companies have adopted the 1-1-1 model. He is the owner and co-chair of TIME.

name: Mel Lim
title: Founder & CEO at Chateauz | AI + 5D XR for Human Experience & Performance | Frontier Tech Builder
about:
Mel Lim is a frontier tech futurist, a single mother of two boys, and a cancer survivor. A Mensa member since age 12, she exemplifies high-functioning intelligence, combining her expertise in systems planning and architectural design with a visionary approach to technology and human experience. Throughout her career, she has launched more than 20 tech products, securing $300M in capital raises and earning over 100 design awards. Mel's work spans neuroscience, cybersecurity, robotics, AI, hospitality, and retail, pushing the frontiers of cutting-edge technologies across global industries. As a published author and sought-after lecturer, Mel shares her insights on innovation, XR/spatial computing, and women in leadership at institutions such as Stanford University, Microsoft, and KPMG. Beyond her professional success, she harbors a deep curiosity for quantum physics and the future of human transcendence, exploring the intersections of machine intelligence and human potential. Her love for boba and noodles keeps her grounded, even as she traverses between XR dimensions and the vast, interconnected cosmos.

Founder of Chateauz‚Ñ¢ ‚Äî an AI-powered XR platform fusing cognitive science, spatial computing, and data intelligence to advance human performance through 5D visualization, simulation, and immersive training. Built for dual-use, mission-critical and workforce readiness across Space & Defense, Industry 4.0 (Advanced Manufacturing & Energy) and Real Estate ‚Äî where speed, precision, and adaptability are non-negotiable.

name: Yohan Lee, PhD
title: AI Tech Founder | Human-Edifying AI to Transform Lives
about:
I always knew I wanted to help people using computers, but I wasn‚Äôt sure how to get from software to the kind of miraculous tech and medicine only seen in science fiction. I started as a student researcher in a neuroscience lab studying a brain molecule which showed promise for blocking drug addictions. This experience led to my first scientific paper and then a PhD in bioinformatics. This was the first dream fulfilled: the chance to combine my love of computers and math to predict outcomes, make medicine, and heal real people from terminal cancer.

When I graduated, I worked at the National Institutes of Health with some of the world‚Äôs best scientists and then Booz Allen with some of the world‚Äôs best technologists to solve big problems with big tech. In just a few years, I was supporting and leading capture for contracts totaling over $100M spanning infrastructure, healthcare, defense, and commercial products. The result was a lasting impact made possible through partnerships with academia, government, and corporations to make them sustainable in the way that only commercial enterprise can at scale. Global commerce became the norm when I was recruited to Google AI where world-class scientists, entrepreneurs and Machine Learning led to new products, markets, and ventures that made those early dreams a reality. Success in these Industry-leading enterprises revealed new opportunities where the risk of high velocity startups met reward with the most successful Kaggle competition of 2020, creation of overseas business units, becoming #1 on the Apple App Store / Google Play Store, and an institutional fundraising round of $174M.

All of it is humbling, a privilege undeserved. Accomplishing these kinds of dreams continually affirms that humbling oneself to a loving higher power, can lead to an impact unimagined. And then you discover that the higher power was the one who put those dreams in your heart in the first place.

Outside of work, I serve on the Board of Revive Presbyterian Church of Silicon Valley; an organization committed to reaching the nations of Silicon Valley and engaging the lives of the homeless, marginalized, and vulnerable within our city.

I enjoy traveling, speaking at conferences, and sharing a positive vision of AI solving some of our society‚Äôs toughest problems for good.

If you ever want to bounce ideas off of me where AI can be used for good and address homelessness, feel free to contact me on Twitter @YLbfx!

name: Arnold Bitner
title: Digitizing your safety-critical processes!
about:
I am a co-founder and CRO of modelwise, a company that makes knowledge applicable by digitizing and automating functional safety processes as per ISO 26262 and IEC 61508 standards. We developed paitron, the first tool to automate safety analyses like FMEA and FMEDA based on ECAD models from standard environments. With minimal overhead and maximum automation, we help our clients achieve higher efficiency and better quality during the development of safety-critical systems.

I have a M.Sc. in Information Systems from the Technical University of Munich, where I also worked as a researcher and a student researcher for various start-up projects. I conducted market and customer research, business development, customer acquisition and management, and presentations on conferences and fairs. I also received the ITK Student Award for my bachelor thesis on developing a vehicle configurator based on model-based methods and modeling. I participated in the Berkeley SkyDeck program at the University of California, Berkeley, where I learnt from and networked with global entrepreneurs and innovators. 

As an information system scientist, I connect both commercial knowledge with technical experience. I have expertise in failure modes, effects, and diagnostic analysis (FMEDA), C#, and software engineering. I am passionate about implementing start-up concepts that solve real-world problems and create value for customers. I am also a member of the Industry Advisor Forum at CEN and CENELEC, where I provide recommendations on strategic standardization priority topics for the industry. Plus, i contribute to the standardization work on a national level at DKE for IEC 61508.

name: Andrew Blount
title: Founder and CEO of Biocurrent, Inc.   #medtech #ai #neuromodulation #inventor
about:
Born in 1973, Andrew Blount grew up in a single-wide trailer. At age 6, Andrew taught himself how to write computer software. By age 8, he started High Altitude Software developing software for the Radio Shack TRS-80 color computer, including in database applications, games and utilities. 

In 1996, Andrew started Realhound.com specializing in SaaS commercial real estate software serving companies like CBRE, Marcus & Millichap and Fannie Mae. Andrew's software has been used to close/finance $100b+ of real estate acquisitions.

In 2000, Andrew was the data scientist/engineer (20% owner) who developed YieldStar Revenue Management, inventing the supply and demand algorithm for the Multi-Family industry's first, most widely used revenue management pricing model.  In 2002, Andrew developed Portfolio, the industry‚Äôs first business intelligence software to provide for multi-family owners and managers, selling it to RealPage, Inc. (NASDAQ:RP) in June of 2002.

From 2015-2020, Andrew served as an EVP and Section 16 officer for RealPage (NASDAQ:RP) $RP participating in the growth of RealPage from $1.4b to $6b+ in market capitalization, leading 4000+ RealPage employees including global Engineering, Software Development, Consumer Services and Travel (Kigo connected to AirBnB, Expedia, Booking.com). 

From 2012-2016 Andrew served as City Councilman/Mayor for Laguna Hills, California, implementing his fiscal and social agenda.  As a rabid supporter of his community, his family decorated their home in Orange County for Christmas with one of America‚Äôs most renowned Christmas Lights Displays attracting 200,000+ visitors each December and touring 100,000+ people through our home each year. Featured on ABC‚Äôs The Great Light Fight and TLCs Four Houses their home spread goodwill internationally.  Andrew designed and engineered the lighting display of over 120,000+ LED lights synchronized to music while Michelle spent six months each year building an interior winter wonderland.

In February 2022, Andrew founded Biocurrent, Inc. Biocurrent, Inc., an early stage bioelectronic medicine company with a clear path to Sustainable Revenue. The Company's research into non-invasive neuromodulation led to the development of an advanced prototype device, database, and machine learning engine which may be effective at treating a wide range of neurological disorders and disabilities including pain, addiction, and cancer. 

Only God is Good,
God has a plan,
We are where we are supposed to be.

+1-949-922-2639  (Voice, iMessage or WhatsApp)

name: Zac Rosenbauer
title: Co-founder at Joggr | Using AI ü§ñ to automate dev docs
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
As a curious youngster, my parents came home and found their computer in pieces scattered around the floor...I just wanted to know how it worked! Always curious and a bit overly ambitious I built my first web page back in 2001 when my grandfather gave me a book on HTML, CSS, and Javascript. From those early days "playing" on my grandfather's PC (and tearing apart my parent's computer), I knew I wanted to work in technology. 

While still in high school I started to dabble with WordPress theming and began to freelance, building marketing sites for local small businesses. I went on to start my first "tech" company, MySportHighlights.com, in 2011.

Since that first company, I've focused the majority of my career on technology and startups. I co-founded PointStart.io (while playing D1 football at Toledo), was hired as engineer #2 at Neighborhoods.com, ran all security & technology-based efforts at Precognitive (acquired by ShopRunner 2018), led Platform Engineering at ShopRunner (Acquired by FedEx in 2020), and most recently I led the Platform Engineering organization as a Director at FedEx Dataworks (CloudOps, SRE, Security, Fraud).

I'm currently the CTO & Co-founder of Joggr.

name: P√•l H√∏ye
title: CTO @ BlueJam | Bring strategy to life
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
Technology is transforming every part of our lives. What used to be dreams are quickly becoming reality.

I am a technology leader and builder with experience across engineering, architecture, product development, and organizational design. I have helped launch products, scale platforms, grow teams, and shape systems that support fast-paced innovation. I have also designed engineering organizations and rapidly scaled them to support growth, alignment, and long-term sustainability.

I am passionate about using technology as a force for good, solving meaningful problems through great products and high-trust teams. I focus on the intersection of people, systems, and outcomes, where technical depth meets clear direction and purposeful collaboration.

Some of my core beliefs that guide me:

* 10x teams over 10x individuals (focus on building great teams)
* The best ideas are simple (simplicity takes extra effort, not less)
* Problem comes before the solution (there is always more than one solution)
* Right-to-left thinking (start with the outcome and discover what you need)
* Dare to experiment (always be learning)
* Trust is earned (no entitlements)
* Clarity of goals paired with ownership leads to great outcomes
* The ‚Äúwhat‚Äù should be accompanied by the ‚Äúwhy‚Äù not the ‚Äúhow‚Äù (the team needs flexibility on the ‚Äúhow‚Äù)

I am especially drawn to complex, high-leverage domains like applied AI, machine learning engineering, scalable infrastructure, and developer platforms. I am particularly interested in supporting teams working at the intersection of AI research and real-world applications, where robust engineering and thoughtful system design are critical to making advanced models useful, safe, and impactful.

name: Ashtan Moore
title: Half impresario, half eminence gris√©; I build & grow companies, and help others do the same.
about:
Ashtan Moore is fervently passionate about growth, especially yours. From his simple roots as a homeschooled Virginia transplant, Ashtan has ‚Äúfailed up‚Äù into an internationally-recognized entrepreneur, speaker, investor, and advisor. As co-founder and partner at Model B, an AI-powered performance ad agency, Ashtan has achieved notable results and driven powerful growth for brands that include Anheuser-Busch, Cognizant, Gilead Sciences, GN Store Nord, Planet Inc., SandboxAQ, ServiceNow, and SailPoint. 

Model B supports growth-minded companies to steadily scale top-line revenue through paid advertising. The agency provides the perfect blend of AI-driven media analytics and global-tier ad creatives to reach the right person with the right message in the right place. Model B is a foremost leader in helping companies reach their next round of funding or desired revenue milestone with impactful creative and data-driven paid media management.

Ashtan has served as a growth consultant for hundreds of successful companies. He‚Äôs also founded, invested in, and operated 10+ businesses of his own since his 21st birthday (when he was certain he knew everything and yet actually knew nothing). His goal is to help founders and executives who are genuinely committed to the growth of their organization. Ashtan facilitates this with his magical ingredient: effective, results-driven advertising.

‚ÄúHelp‚Äù is a word Ashtan uses a lot. Helping people, forging connections, coaching, and reading the heart of a business so that he may help realize its true potential. The secret to a successful business ‚Äì and a successful human ‚Äì is driving value.

Ashtan believes that none of the entrepreneurs who build our economy should have to do it alone, which is why his passion is bringing together the most talented people to create impactful and successful companies; none of this would be possible without his incredibly talented community of founders, executives, teammates, strategic partners, and friends. They are, as he says, his very own ‚Äúsecret sauce to success.‚Äù

When he‚Äôs not starting his own companies, propelling yours toward sustainable growth, helping entrepreneurs get it right, or brainstorming a right-fit marketing strategy, he serves on the boards of non-profit organizations, including the Entrepreneur‚Äôs Organization (EO) and Entrepreneurly; these non-profits support newer-to-market companies to seasoned entrepreneurs each on their own unique growth journey.

Age: 42 [+13]

Sleepless Nights: All of ‚Äòem

Crash-and-Burn Dot Com Bubble Failures: 1  -- c. 2000

Total Checks Written by Equity Investors/Acquirers across all 4 Startups -- $33MM+

Total Unique/Amazing Baltimore-area Employees that Have Been Employed by these 3 Startups -- 100+ (200+ worldwide)

But I believe professional identity on LinkedIn is not all about one‚Äôs age, startup equity, and exits. Rather, I believe...

It‚Äôs all about the people.

I believe in these words as a tech entrepreneur, an online marketing veteran, a musician, an academic, a husband/father, and as a seeker of inspiration. It is a philosophy that I live by.

Please review and research all the businesses listed below that I am involved with these days. They are all amazing growing businesses and they are all hiring. name: Joyce Hill

about:
Preserving the gift of vision has been our passion for over 30 years. 

World wide delivery of devices, instruments and products required by Ophthalmic Surgeons providing eye care to their patients at facilities and on mission trips to under-served areas.

Diagnostic, Surgical, and Medical devices and supplies for ophthalmology practices and missions including surgical microscopes, surgical video systems, surgical lasers, phacos, cryo surgical systems, slit lamps, OCTs, instrumentation, consumables, and disposables.

We buy, refurbish, and sell the top brands and models, to insure our customers will have the highest quality equipment on the market. We specialize in equipment for cataract and retinal surgery, such as phacoemulsifiers, vitreo-retinal machines, microscopes, lasers, and accessories. We carry some diagnostic items, such as slit lamps. 

We strive to offer the best customer service, which has built our business on referrals and repeat customers. We stand behind what we sell, and will do whatever it takes to correct a problem. 

It is our honor to assist charitable organizations by helping them procure the necessary equipment, to provide eye care to those in need

name: Robert Elessar
title: Founder + Director at Evela
about:
I own and run a minimalist skincare company called Evela. The idea sprung from creating a branding package for a chemist who in the end didn't have the resources to start a company, so I modified it a bit, added my love of minimalism, brutalism and fashion to create my own minimalist skincare company.

I created the entire branding and design for the company and also run the business. We've launched with our Chilean Rose Hip Oil after I found the best source of Rose Hip Oil in the world in my home country of Chile.

We're Eco-Friendly and aim to be completely sustainable in the near future, through our own efforts and partnerships with sustainable suppliers and manufacturers. We try to use recycled packaging where possible and also as little packaging as possible so we can at least try for a zero waste future. Everything in the packaging supply chain takes sustainability into consideration and is also Australian.

I still do branding but only for people I know or if I think the project is fire.

name: Laurent Martinot
title: Co-Founder & CEO at Sunrise
about:
I‚Äôm Laurent Martinot, Founder and CEO of Sunrise, where we‚Äôre transforming the way sleep health is diagnosed and managed. After starting my career as a lawyer, I have led the commercialization and acquisition of Medisoft Group‚Äîleading manufacturer of pulmonary function testing technologies‚Äîa journey during which I observed the major challenges in accessing care across our health systems.

With my father being a passionate sleep physician and a renowned medical author, I‚Äôve always been connected to the importance of sleep health. This inspired me to co-found Sunrise with my brother Pierre, an engineer whose technical expertise has been essential to developing the transformative products shaping our work.

Today, the Sunrise Home Sleep Test, together with our digital sleep clinic Dreem Health, helps thousands of patients across Europe and the U.S. get diagnosed and treated for sleep apnea‚Äîa serious condition affecting over 1 billion people globally, with up to 80% of cases undiagnosed. We have created an integrated care pathway allowing patients to consult with sleep specialists much faster, all from the comfort of their home.

What sets Sunrise apart is the strong foundation of science and research driving our company. Over the years, we have developed medical technologies that are backed by unparalleled clinical results, have been featured in top peer-reviewed journals with contributions from several of the leading global experts in the field, and advanced the understanding of sleep apnea. Building on these foundations, we aim to use our expertise to improve care for all sleep patients.
speaking_engagements: Interview with TechRound about Sunrise and sleep apnea awareness; Interview with Center for Data Innovation discussing sleep data and technology
reasoning: Laurent Martinot demonstrates proven operator experience with a successful exit through the Medisoft Group acquisition, followed by founding Sunrise, which has shown significant traction in the sleep health space. As Founder and CEO of Immerse, I‚Äôm building a new kind of wellness experience. Immerse is an immersive hot yoga and Pilates studio chain where nature-inspired landscapes, curated soundscapes, heat, and aromatherapy come together to transport our members into a multi-sensory journey. Hi, I'm Rachael and I hire AI Engineers for super unique companies in Germany! 

We founded Neural AI to bring our own personal touch to the world of recruitment and help companies to really thrive and grow organically with the right types of people. about:
I‚Äôve always believed that imagination is the bridge between what is and what could be. My life‚Äôs work is rooted in blending creativity, design, and technology to inspire joy, connection, and wonder ‚Äî whether through books, stories, or groundbreaking experiences, both on-screen and off.

As the Founder & CEO of Storytailor, I‚Äôve channeled this vision into creating a platform that redefines storytelling ‚Äî making it inclusive, therapeutic, and deeply personal for children (and those who once were children). Beyond Storytailor, my journey is a lifelong commitment to empowering whimsical imagination as a tool for healing, representation, and growth.

Think of it as bringing the legacy of Willy Wonka into the digital age: a world where imagination bridges the gap between adults and children, fostering shared wonder and creativity. It‚Äôs a mission I‚Äôll pursue to my grave.

My hope? To inspire a world where creativity meets purpose, and every child (and their inner child) feels they truly belong.

We are building AI agents reliable enough for real business operations. At CogniSwitch, we're helping enterprises automate their complex SOPs with 100% reliability - because in business, almost perfect isn't good enough. Especially in high stakes industries. 

Interesting backstory: I previously built and scaled iZooto to become the world's second-largest push notification platform (1500+ global media businesses). That journey taught me that enterprise success isn't about the technology itself - it's about making it work reliably at scale. 

Right now, there's a massive gap between AI's potential and operational reality. Most AI solutions are impressive in demos but fall short in real-world operations. We're changing that narrative, one enterprise at a time. 

Let's talk if you're frustrated with the gap between AI demos and real implementation and are looking to automate complex SOPs without sacrificing reliability.

name: David Berkal
title: CEO at Banyan Software
about:
David is passionate about building organizations, leading teams and executing against winning strategies. He is an entrepreneur with experience in operations, M&A, strategy, sales and marketing. In 2016 he brought together a world-class group of CEO's and investors to start Banyan Software, a software acquirer with a family office-like structure. With permanent capital, Banyan provides enterprise software owners with a better option when thinking about a succession plan or liquidity event. Today Banyan is growing companies across numerous software verticals including healthcare, financial services, media, education, and transportation. 

David last acted as CEO of Medicat, LLC the leading patient health management system in the college health market, covering over 3.5M students today. Previously, David led Shift Technologies expansion into new markets across the US after a $50M round of financing. Prior to that, David worked in private equity and value investing, where he was responsible for sourcing, conducting due diligence and making investments across various sectors including healthcare, technology and retail.

David is the co-founder and former Executive Director of Operation Groundswell, a travel social-enterprise with programs in a dozen countries. He is also the co-founder of the Canadian Roots Exchange (now Indigenous Youth Roots). 

David holds an MBA from the Stanford Graduate School of Business, a BA from the University of Toronto where he was a National Millennium Scholar, and is a graduate of Next Canada's entrepreneurial leadership institute where he was Valedictorian.

name: Brian Smith
title: CEO of Supply Chain and Freight Management Solutions
about:
Since joining Banyan Technology as CEO in May 2016, Brian Smith has quickly positioned the company to lead an industry revolution; displacing decades-old technology for live connectivity that helps shippers, brokers, and 3PLs boost efficiency and deliver permanent reductions in shipping costs. During his time at the helm, Banyan has accelerated hiring across all departments, completed a full company rebrand and secured $10 million in a recent equity funding and financing round.

Before leading Banyan, Smith was the President and Chief Operating Officer of Proforma printing and promotion solutions. At Proforma, Smith was instrumental in growing the company‚Äôs annual revenue from $40 million to $400 million over two decades. This proven track record of translating vision into result-oriented execution is why the Banyan Board of Directors brought Smith on in early 2016 as CEO. 

Founded in 2001, Banyan pioneered the integration of API Carrier connectivity for over-the-road freight, transforming real-time rating and scheduling for the logistics industry. As the first company to bring this innovation to the market, Banyan set a new standard for how Clients connect with their Carrier networks, making freight management systems more efficient and transparent.

Over recent years, Banyan‚Äôs growth has been significant, repeatedly earning recognition on FreightWaves‚Äô FreightTech 100 and Inc. Magazine‚Äôs Inc. 5000 list of the fastest-growing private companies. This success is grounded in a strategy of steady growth and a commitment to Client-centric service. Our onboarding, support and service approach fosters long-term relationships and informs the continuous development of our technology, built around Client needs.

Building on a strong foundation of innovation, Banyan continues to lead the industry, redefining standards for visibility, transparency and freight spend management. The patented LIVE Connect platform delivers end-to-end solutions across TL, LTL, Parcel and Final Mile shipping, offering advanced automation tools, real-time rating capabilities and predictive pricing models to optimize every stage of freight operations.

LIVE Connect integrates features such as AI and BI tools, automated accessorial verification, freight claims management, risk mitigation solutions and insurance services, giving Clients the flexibility, visibility and control they need to optimize freight spend. Through continuous innovation and strategic partnerships, Banyan ensures that its solutions not only meet but anticipate the evolving demands of the logistics industry.

With a career at the intersection of production, product innovation, and cultural strategy, Preston McGee is a systems architect with a rare ability to turn complexity into clarity‚Äîbuilding companies that solve real operational challenges for creators and cultural professionals. name: Nicholas Hinrichsen
title: Turning Credit Unions into future-proof FinTechs | CU Advisory Board Member, CEO / Co-Founder at Clutch (CUSO).
about:
Consumer lending is broken and Americans are overpaying billions of dollars in interest. 

Here's the problem: consumers don't shop for loans. They shop for products!

When you buy a vehicle for example, do you really think the dealer has your best interest in mind? When you get your loan at the dealership, the finance manager will give you the loan that's best for him and not best for you!

The same is true for all kinds of consumer debt and Americans don't even realize. Not all hope is lost though! Credit Unions - tax-exempt non-profits - help Americans with their financial wellness and really want to try to help consumers. 

We believe that with a little bit of technology help, billions of dollars will move from commercial lenders to these mission-driven organizations. We're on a mission to turn Credit Unions into technology companies!

In 2017, my co-founder Chris Coleman and I sold our previous company to Carvana.com. We helped the digital car retailer grow exponentially and started Clutch in 2020. Since we‚Äôve started Clutch, we‚Äôve grown the business to process billions of dollars in loan applications and saved consumers hundreds of millions in interest charges. 

We couldn't do any of this without the tireless support from Andreessen Horowitz, CMFG, Curql, Peterson Partners and the Cultural Leadership Fund as well as our 55 angels including Andy Rachleff, Gokul Rajaram, Manik Gupta, Rahul Vohra, Lenny Rachitsky, Sriram Krishnan, Brian Reed, Danny Shader, Parker Treacy, Aadik Shekar, Florian Hagenbuch, Mate Pencz, Andres Andrade, Fernando Gadotti, Marcos Salama, Jake Miller, Peter Livingston, Jim Ellis and Kevin Taweel. 

We feel humbled by your vote of confidence and are thrilled to support the Credit Union movement.

name: Andrii Bidochko

about:
Overwhelmed by the slow pace of software development? Struggling to navigate the complexities of AI systems and the high costs associated with industry talent?

If you're a business owner seeking to digitize your operations and harness the power of AI, this could be a familiar narrative. But what if you could accelerate your development team, simplify AI deployment, and lower costs all at once?

Welcome! I'm the CEO/CTO of UBOS.tech, a platform designed to address these precise pain points. With an extensive technical background in AI and software development, I've steered our team towards a single goal - to empower businesses to become autonomous, AI-first organizations.

UBOS (Unified Business Operating System) is a leading-edge low-code/no-code application development platform. It streamlines the process of creating AI-powered solutions, transforming digital aspirations into reality. By chaining multiple LLM or AI/ML API services into a single flow, we're breaking down the barriers to AI adoption.

The benefits? Expect a boost in efficiency and productivity across your technical and business teams. With UBOS as your Business 3.0 operating system, you can create custom AI-powered applications faster, giving you a significant edge over your competitors in the technology race of the 21st century.

But what if you lack the AI expertise or extensive coding knowledge? Don't worry, that's the beauty of UBOS.tech! We've designed our platform to be accessible to businesses of all sizes and levels of tech expertise.

Let's equip your team with the tools to create your digital future. Reach out to me today and explore how UBOS.tech can propel your business into the AI age.

name: Mohammad Shehata, PhD

about:
I am a Ph.D. neuroscience professional and an entrepreneur with a unique blend of expertise in both fields. My passion lies in exploring the balance between Human Natural Intelligence (HI) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) to enhance humanity‚Äôs collective intelligence.

‚ñ∫ As a neuroscientist, I am deeply curious about the neural bases of human behavior, particularly how we can maintain and elevate human cognitive abilities while integrating AI into our lives. My research expertise spans team flow, experimental psychology, teamwork, and learning and memory‚Äîall aimed at preserving and advancing natural intelligence in this era of AI innovation.

I lead several NASA-funded projects at the California Institute of Technology (Caltech) focused on using neural correlates to develop tools that measure team flow. These projects will result in patented products designed to analyze productivity, preferences, and synchronization in teams.

üß† My 15+ years of research began with studying how the brain stores memories, leading to key discoveries featured in J Neurosci and Science:
- Developed a method to erase fear memories
- Discovered how the brain stores connected yet independent memories (memory identity)

üß† I discovered the neuroscience of team flow, examining what happens biologically when teams work ‚Äúin the zone.‚Äù This research, published in eNeuro, has been featured in The Times Magazine London, Scientific American (Arabic), Psychology Today, IFL Science, Science Alert, and SciShow News.

‚ñ∫ As an entrepreneur, I‚Äôm the CEO/founder of FiLiCiTi, Inc., where we combine data-driven brain science with AI to develop innovative strategies and tools that promote both human natural intelligence (HI) for individuals and organizations. Our mission is to bridge human natural and artificial intelligence for a more integrated and productive collective intelligence.

about:
I am Co-founder and Chief Medical Officer of Acie (http://acie.skin) - Personalized AI Skincare Coach. 
Acie is the world's first AI-powered skin-monitoring device for everyday use, making skin data transparent and accessible for everyone. Acie‚Äôs solution includes a smart, all-in-one skincare device connected to a mobile app, powered by advanced AI and biosensors. Our breakthrough is based on our U.S.-patented technology that combines built-in cosmetics capsules and skin biosensors into one single applicator so that users can care for their skin anywhere and effortlessly monitor their skin health daily.

I am also a Scientific Writer at Ayming, combining technology and scientific writing to support and encourage innovative Canadian businesses in their claims to the Scientific Research and Experimental Development (SR&ED) tax credits program.

I worked as a Post-Doctoral Researcher at the Dermatology Investigation Unit of Instituto de Medicina Molecular Jo√£o Lobo Antunes and the Dermatology Department of Hospital Santa Maria (Lisbon, Portugal), studying the effects of biological therapies on low- and normal-density neutrophils in inflammatory skin diseases such as psoriasis.

I hold a Ph.D. in Biotechnology and Biosciences from Instituto Superior T√©cnico (IST), University of Lisbon, where I worked in the development of fluorescence-based biosensors for medical diagnostics.
I also did a Post-Graduation in Advanced Studies in Bioengineering under the MIT Portugal Program and a Master's in Biomedical Engineering at NOVA's School of Science and Technology (Almada, Portugal).

Me:  Highly experienced, expert level, multi-disciplinary product developer of complex technical systems with a particular specialism in signals:
Professional Digital Signal Processing and Communication systems R&D
High performance Professional and Consumer audio / video custom systems design, development & manufacturing.

Real-time de-packetize/decrypt/process/re-encrypt/re-insert hardware development.  OEM / ODM liaison.
Radio Frequency and Optical wireless communications systems employing both digital and analog modulation at high bandwidth rates at uhf / shf / microwave / optic wavelengths.  Countermeasures broadband and agile jammers, RF-ECM, RF-ECCM. Cavium secure network processor integration design.
Electro-Optics   transmitter / modulator and receiver / demodulator design. Ultra high link integrity optic communication links.  Experience with various digital modulation schemes PSK, FSK, FHSS, QAM, OFDM, MANET.

High efficiency power converter design and development
Aerospace / MIL Industry R&D experience.
Autonomous robotic systems.

I'm not interested in just writing code, that's totally boring to me.  I create and invent new technologies.
Certainly different (not visibly) and deep thinking skills perhaps likely due to the teratogen Thalidomide, I am however thankful to have survived it.
Fundamentally though, I am a Physicist at heart with an obsession for QED (to be specific, that's Quantum Electro-Dynamics which concerns the interaction of photons (quantum energy particles) and physical matter, not the latin phrase quod erat demonstrandum).

name: Robyn J. Grable
title: A champion for dignity, purpose, and community transformation. | A world where every individual has the support they need, to truly ASCEND. | We are Making a Difference | SDVOSB | U.S. Navy Veteran
about:
Some choices haunt you forever.
Others set you free.

In 1983, at Jacksonville Naval Air Station...I learned the difference.

I was a model sailor.
Advancing quickly.
Five months pregnant. About to transfer to Maine.

"It's not safe to drive alone at night..."
My supervisor said.
"Meet me at the Winn-Dixie parking lot..."
"I'll escort you to the going-away dinner."

Orders from a superior.
Someone who wore our uniform. Someone meant to protect their own.

But in that dark lot...He betrayed everything we stand for.
Everything the uniform means.
Every sacred trust between leaders and those they command.

His threat was clear: "If you tell anybody...I'll have your orders canceled. Make your life hell."

So I chose silence...To protect my unborn daughter.
Her future over my justice. Her tomorrow over my today.

Because real warriors fight for others...
Even when it costs them everything.

Getting out wasn't a choice I wanted to make.
But after nine years of service...My body and spirit needed healing.

What followed was more damaging than healing:
Twelve years of hearing...
"Your leadership doesn't count."
"Your experience isn't relevant."
"Your service doesn't translate."

Ten different jobs.
Each one a reminder...
That the uniform that once made me visible...
Now made me invisible to civilian employers.

As a single mom...
Every rejection wasn't just about me.
It was about my daughter.
The same one I'd sacrificed justice to protect.

The irony wasn't lost:
I could lead sailors through crisis...Train hundreds of recruits...Create support systems at every base...
But couldn't get a civilian job worthy of my skills.

And it's not just me.

Veteran underemployed. Military spouse unemployment. 150,000 military families...Can't put food on their table.

Despite world-class training. Despite proven leadership. Despite mission-critical skills.

The problem isn't their skills.
It's that nobody sees their value.

We built something different at The ASCEND Collective.
A system that recognizes worth.

Here's what makes The ASCEND Collective different:
Every match gets an interview.
No more applications vanishing into the void.
Because when you match true skills...
To organizations that need them...
Magic happens.

This isn't charity.
This is continuing the mission...
For those who served.

Just as they fought for our tomorrow...
Now it's our turn to fight for their future.
It continues the sacred tradition: Warriors taking care of warriors.

Because the truest act of service...
Is fighting for those who once fought for us.
Opening doors so that others may thrive.

notable_achievements: Helped connect individuals with Habitat for Humanity through Upstate Warrior Solution
reasoning: Robyn Grable demonstrates significant professional experience including military leadership and subsequent civilian career transitions. Her background as a U.S. Navy veteran with 9 years of service, combined with leadership experience training recruits and managing teams, places her in the Technical and Management Veterans category. Her Masters in Psychology with Leadership Coaching focus and founding of The ASCEND Collective shows progression into entrepreneurship, but without clear evidence of major scale or exits yet. name: Mina Guirguis
title: Professor of Computer Science @ Texas State | Founder @ Blocmount
about:
Mina Guirguis is a computer scientist with over 20 years of experience in the area of cybersecurity. Mina spent 6 years at Boston University conducting research in the area of network security followed by 18 years at Texas State University conducting research in the area of securing Cyber-Physical Systems (CPS), Internet of Things (IoT), Wireless Networks and Cloud Computing. Mina's research work has been published in over 50 refereed papers, posters, journals, and book chapters, funded by over $4.3M research awards from the National Science Foundation, Department of Defense, Air Force Office of Scientific Research, Department of Homeland Security, IEEE, Cisco and Texas State University. Mina received the NSF CAREER award in 2012.

Mina has a wide range of industrial and research engagement experience at various companies, including Microsoft and Fortress Technologies (acquired by General Dynamics). He has been a visiting researcher at the Air Force Research Laboratory (AFRL) in the summers of 2012 and 2013. Mina joined the Mobile and Pervasive Computing Group in the ECE Dept. at UT Austin over the 2014/2015 academic year. Mina has also been a visiting scholar at the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) Center for Risk and Economic Analysis of Terrorism Events (CREATE) hosted at the University of Southern California (USC) in the summer of 2016.

Mina is currently a Professor of Computer Science at Texas State University and the director of the Intelligent Security Group. He is also the founder of Blocmount -- a technology startup that provides data analytics tech for industrial control systems. Blocmount received an SBIR Phase I award for $256K from the NSF in September 2022.

Mina received his Ph.D. in Computer Science from Boston University in 2006.

Aurelia Edwards is the Founder and CEO of Nailstry. As a licensed massage therapist with a master‚Äôs degree in cosmetic science, it isn't surprising that her career in wellness has been influential in creating a beauty tech company.  Inspired by a wedding and 2 missing press-on nails, Nailstry was developed to fill in the gap between accessibility and nail sizing in the press-on nail industry.

Nailstry‚Äôs journey started as Tips Nail Store, a pop-up shop in New York City‚Äôs iconic West Village.  This interactive concept store manually sized customers before they discovered and shopped custom-designed nail art from our partnered nail designers and artists.  The demand for an online presence prompted the build out of an app-based marketplace that integrated a virtual sizing solution.

about:
My journey into mental health innovation began with a profound realisation that despite advances in healthcare technology, our approach to mental wellbeing remains fragmented and reactive. This observation, coupled with my personal experiences navigating mental health challenges, ignited my mission to build something transformative.

At MindSmith, I'm building an interconnected ecosystem that addresses the complete landscape of mental wellbeing. My unique strength lies in bridging the gap between business innovation and human-centered mental health solutions, creating a future where advanced technology and personalized approaches empower individuals to proactively manage their well-being.

Drawing from my MBA background and entrepreneurial experience, I approach mental health challenges with both strategic business acumen and genuine empathy. This dual perspective allows me to develop solutions that are not only clinically effective but also operationally sustainable and scalable.

What drives me is the vision of mental healthcare that doesn't just treat symptoms but transforms lives through personalized, preventative, and empowering approaches. I believe in building systems that are ethical, accessible, and centered on human dignity.

Alongside work, I host the Neural Genesis, a 7-day immersive transformation combining neuroscience and ancient embodied wisdom, designed to catalyse quantum breakthroughs for high performers ready to meet their next evolution.

I'm always open to connecting with fellow innovators, mental health professionals, investors with patient capital looking to make meaningful impact, and potential partners who share my vision for revolutionizing mental health through ecosystem thinking.
